DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! I bought this game and I turned the FPS to uncapped and made the graphics high as my PC should be able to handle it. It immediately sounded like a spaceship taking off. I looked at my CPU temps and it was peaking at 90 degrees Celsius. I looked on the EA forums and it is a bug that the game runs entirely off you CPU and not on your GPU. The EA staff member replied telling people to check BIOS and there was nine pages of people telling him he's wrong and not a single reply. This apparently existed in Madden 23 for PC and was never fixed. Don't fry your CPU trying to play a cash grab of a football game

Don't even bother. It's hit or miss whether the game will run on your PC regardless of your specs. Personally, I can't even get the game to launch because EA AntiCheat is so broken and can't figure out how to install itself correctly on my computer. After hours of troubleshooting and reading countless accounts from other users with similar issues, I've just come to the conclusion that there are certain PCs that this game just WILL NOT run on. 

Even for my friends who HAVE been able to get the game running, it's SO unoptimized and poorly ported. We've experienced constant severe graphical issues (so bad they could potentially be a seizure risk), and just TERRIBLE performance even on monstrously high spec PCs. Thank God for Steam refunds because it's downright criminal to sell a product THIS non-functioning and misrepresentative for $70. Once again, PC owning football fans are SOL. Shove it, EA.

My biggest complaint so far is that it is virtually impossible to start a franchise with a created character that has to climb up from the bottom of the depth chart because no matter where you are on the depth chart, the game acts like you are the starter. For example: I created a QB with the undrafted rookie option. His overall was about 61. It put me at 3rd on the depth chart but for some reason, at the beginning of every preseason game, the coach sends me a message talking about his expectations for me for the game and which quarters I'm going to be playing. Problem with that is that my guy never sees the field. Then the game registers that as my character underperforming and then I get negative messages from the coach about my performance (even though I didn't play a single snap) and this goes on for a few weeks into the regular season about how poor my performance has been until, one week, you get a message for the OC saying that if you don't perform well in the next game you are going to get cut. Don't play a single snap. I apparently didn't meet expectations from my spot on the bench. Get cut a few weeks into regular season. Stuck at an overall of about 65. Can't practice or do anything else to raise overall while on the Free Agent list. Nobody wants a QB with such a low overall. Stuck on Free Agents without any offers for a couple years without any contract offers (even as a backup) before giving up. Tried this a few different times with a few different teams with the same exact result every time. Fix this by making the game recognize that your character isn't a starter (or even getting any snaps for that matter) and I might be able to enjoy this.

EDIT: Apparently the game crashes every time I try to do training camp as a coach in franchise mode as well.

24 minutes... I spent 6 minutes creating two OP characters with the creation suite, 5 minutes on the field, and 13 minutes trying to figure out a broken controller system. I never often write reviews this thorough but "this" had me shook. I am not within the realm of Madden games regularly. Thought I would try out this one as the SB had me interested. It was on sale so it could not hurt. Plus refunds are a thing if it's not ideal. I don't hate it, I don't like it. It's a sports game, by EA, so I know what I am expecting going into it. What I did not expect was a mess of a broken controller system. We are in the midst of the PS5 and Xbox Series era. Why Madden 24 on PC does not support Dualsense is beyond me. Double controller detection when only one is plugged in, completely wrong button mapping making the game unplayable. Also the game is ugly. It really is not ideal for me. Refunding. Back to Madden 08 on the PS3

I've totaled thousands of hours over the years playing madden.  Bought every year from 2004-2013.  Skipped until 2020 and now purchased 2024.  In my opinion, this year has the best and most believable physics-based gameplay out of any of them.  It goes further than any other madden to not feel "animation locked"  The running, passing and contact between the players feel organic and dynamic.  Not perfect, but pretty darn good.  Free form passing is great - it opens up the playbook and makes variety of routes more viable.  I haven't ran into any game breaking bugs yet.  Menus are slowish to respond.  Routinely get small stutters when returning kicks, but other than that, performance seems passable. about a 6/10.  Running around 100 fps on a 4080 with ultra graphics.  They've added a good amount of superstar abilities.  The coaching tree that buffs your player attributes is mid.  All-in-all I'd say it's a buy on sale.

Moreover, Madden 24 fails to innovate or introduce any significant new features to the franchise. Instead, it feels like a rehash of previous games with minor tweaks and updates. This lack of innovation makes the game feel stale and outdated, especially when compared to other sports games that are constantly pushing the boundaries of gameplay and realism.In conclusion, Madden 24 can be considered a terrible video game due to its lackluster gameplay, and poor graphics and presentation. Rather than building upon the strengths of previous iterations, Madden 24 fails to innovate or deliver a compelling experience for players. As a result, many fans of the franchise have been left feeling disappointed and disillusioned, longing for the days when Madden was synonymous with excellence in sports gaming.

When trying to create a character for superstar mode the game would literally not start. I was stuck in a loading screen. Upon restarting, selecting superstar mode would just kick me back to the previous menu. I had to delete my character, create a new one entirely, and restart the game before actually starting on that character. I went through this bullshit for over an hour, only to be met with the single worst camera angle I have ever seen. I have no idea why, but EA thought it would be a fantastic idea to completely remove the classic camera angle when playing superstar as a QB. I do not want a "realistic" QB camera angle. I am not a QB, let alone an NFL QB. Give me the classic camera angle, not this stupid shit that makes it hard to see. As far as I can tell this camera angle only exists in superstar mode. Which makes the whole thing even more astounding. It wouldn't be a problem if you could change it to the normal angle; after all, there is nothing wrong with giving the player more options. But you do not have any options, you are forced into this stupid ass camera. It is possible to zoom out using the dpad, but this is not changing the angle, it is just zooming out. Which is a band-aid solution to a stupid ass problem that EA created. This is the first time I have played a new Madden since Madden 25. While I enjoy the new passing mechanics as they add a huge amount of depth, the camera angle just completely ruins it. I can see absolutely nothing.

It's the same it has been every season, with worse optimization than prior seasons (I've a much stronger computer compared to when I bought Madden 22) - and there will still be 2-4 times a game where it'll be like I'm watching a PowerPoint presentation as the game's framerate drop to horrendous slideshow levels.
If you play a special mode, like SuperStar, be prepared for horrible UI moments, where you want to skip to the end of the post game XP/Commercials - only to find it seemingly go to the end, and then back to the beginning, so you have to skip to the end once more.
It's almost like they think that flashy animated splash images and whooshing sounds are needed to constantly stimulate our brain, and if you try to avoid them, the game gets angry. As though you skipping the items is invalidating the life's work of someone, so you MUST/WILL be exposed to them and you SHALL enjoy them!
I used to dabble in Ultimate Team mode, however, the UI special effects in that one seem to require more CPU/Video Card power than the actual game with how lag ridden it can be, and heavens forbid you try to navigate faster than it's effects want you to, as when it catches up, you've shot right past where you wanted to be, or reset things to start back at the beginning.
I was forced to retire 4 years into superstar mode as a 2 time SB mvp. thanks!

Hmm where to start... Overall the game is more playable than recent years, there are still kinks that EA needs to address. Defensive coverage mechanics being the first that comes to mind. Receivers can often get bumped by covering defenders, which is fine, however the game does not have an animation for this sometimes. This leads to the ball being sent to where the receiver SHOULD be, based on their route, but does not account for the models colliding. This almost always leads to an interception, or just missed pass (labeled perfect accuracy). It is extremely frustrating in close games where every down counts, too many games have been lost due to this bug. 

Also, there are still plays and schemes that allow defenders to breach the line of scrimmage unimpeded by blockers. This obviously makes sense when the defense sends 5-7 on a blitz, but there is some scheme to have a free rusher when only sending 4... Breaks the game honestly, and it's usually brought out by cheesers at the end of a close game because it's a wincon.

Do not buy this game on Steam. The game is unplayable, and uses nearly 100% of my CPU while not using much of my graphics card. In online games (and even in offline games versus the CPU), the game play suddenly transitions into slow motion at the exact moment the ball is snapped, on top of imposing input lag, rendering the game essentially unplayable. I have tried time and time again to resolve this issue by verifying the game files and running the application as an administrator to no avail. Furthermore, while the application is running, I have attempted to set the affinity in task manager for the application in an attempt to reduce the CPU utilization, just for the program to notify me that I don't have permission to do so, despite the fact that I am logged in on this PC as an administrator, and can set the affinity for other applications while they are running. Everything I have done to aid in helping the game operate as intended (including adjusting the in game graphics settings to the lowest possible, along with prioritizing high performance in the NVIDIA control panel) has led to no change in performance whatsoever. I am not the only one experiencing these issues as well, as plenty others are having the same issue as me. EA has offered no solution to this problem, despite the game having been released in August of 2023. 

If there was any video game company that should not have the sole rights to make an NFL game, it would be EA. As it turns out, EA has procured the sole license to produce these games, and it doesn't take a genius to realize that EA is the ONE company that should not be afforded this privilege considering their track record. Year after year, EA releases this unplayable, creatively bankrupt, and downright execrable garbage and demands 60 (now 70) dollars for it. The most concerning part about this practice is that it works, because EA understands that the NFL is the golden goose of the sports entertainment industry in the United States, and by extension know that this industry is incredibly profitable. Fans of the NFL want an engaging and realistic experience to let their passion for football be expressed through the medium of gaming. Once again, EA knows this and expends the bare minimum effort because EA knows that their product is the closest thing that the average NFL fan will get to expressing this previously mentioned passion. As a result, the fans have no choice but to submit to the morally corrupt institution that is EA.

This is actually My very first Madden purchase, I used to play them back in the day for PS1. I grew up playing mostly 2K but after gaining more of an interest in football I decided to purchase Madden 24 and it did not disappoint. The visuals and presentation of the games are very nice and the fluidity in the movement is smooth. There isn't a huge learning curve and new players can pick up and play pretty easily after getting used to the play calling and controls. As for most games, the more you play the more you learn and become familiar with what plays work best and your go to players. EA also including crossplay with PC/Xbox/PS5 is something I appreciate (Unlike lazy devs such as 2K). I recommend Madden 24 for any fan of football.

The game is legitimately unplayable. This is not an exaggeration or overreaction out of frustration, but simply an honest admission. My PC is what myself and others would consider to be a very nice build that can handle just about any game on maximum settings. And I know this to be true because I have played every single game in my library (including other Maddens) on this exact PC and have had hardly any performance issues. However, this game is absolutely atrocious and simply not playable. Upon start up of the game, my frame rate drops from 120 to 8, and stays that way until the game is fully loaded. Not a huge deal though, as once I get through all of the bullshit advertisements for Ultimate Team that I'm not interested in are gone, I can then select the game mode I want to play. Here's where things start to go sour. No matter what game mode I select to play, my frame rate will immediately cut in half. The game also stutters and freezes throughout this entire process, but the best is yet to come. Once I've loaded the game that I want to play, (which only takes about 10 minutes) my game will freeze after the first few plays, if not sooner, and my frames will never hit over 5 fps.  EVERY. SINGLE. GAME. Without fail. I have put just over 30 hours onto this game, and for this to be an issue for not only myself, but a multitude of others that I have seen complain about similar issues on Discord and Reddit is unacceptable. I deserve a full refund for a piss poor product that doesn't function, however I don't expect to receive one from the money hungry suits at EA.

Madden 24, the latest blunder from the illustrious EA, continues the trend of disappointment and frustration, underscoring the company's blatant disregard for its player base. As we dissect the wreckage of this game, it's impossible to ignore the stranglehold EA maintains on the NFL license, turning a once-thriving franchise into a predictable and lackluster cash grab.

EA's Monopolistic Stranglehold:
A talking point that screams from the mountaintops - EA's exclusive grip on the NFL license is nothing short of a slap in the face to gaming enthusiasts. The absence of competition has left Madden gamers at the mercy of a company more interested in profit margins than delivering a cutting-edge gaming experience. The monopoly not only stifles innovation but also extinguishes any hope of a fresh, competitive alternative to challenge Madden's mediocrity.

Stagnation and Apathy:
EA's monopolistic position has transformed the Madden series into a breeding ground for stagnation and apathy. Why bother innovating when there's no one else in the arena? Madden 24 is a prime example of this lackadaisical approach, with recycled features, half-baked improvements, and an overall sense that the company is content to coast on its exclusive NFL license without pushing the boundaries of gaming excellence.

Player Feedback, or Lack Thereof:
With no competitors nipping at their heels, EA seems to have plugged its ears to the cries of Madden gamers. Glaring issues persist from one release to the next, and the company's indifference to player feedback is as glaring as the flaws in their games. The lack of choice leaves fans with the bitter taste of neglect, as they witness their concerns falling on deaf corporate ears.

A Call for Change:
It's high time for gamers to demand more from EA. The monopolistic hold on the NFL license has given rise to a culture of complacency, where profit takes precedence over player satisfaction. As Madden 24 languishes in its sea of glitches and unfulfilled promises, it's clear that a shake-up is needed. NFL gaming enthusiasts deserve more than a company that treats them like captive customers in a one-sided relationship.

Conclusion:
Madden 24's failings are not just the result of EA's neglect; they are amplified by the company's monopolistic grasp on the NFL license. It's a disheartening reality for gamers who yearn for innovation, competition, and a gaming experience that reflects the passion they have for the sport. EA's actions speak louder than their marketing promises, and as long as they maintain this stranglehold, Madden gamers are left with a bitter taste of disappointment and a company that couldn't care less.

Madden 24 is no different from the Madden's that have come out in the past. Every mode is a mind-numbingly awful experience and a massive waste of time. The career/superstar mode has no immersion in terms of story line and they refuse to fix the early retirement glitch. If I rush for 8000 yards and 84 TDs on All Madden you better fucking believe I'm gonna ask for more money than you're offering me. MUT, in my opinion, is only fun for MUT Squads. However, if you dare to play cross-platform with friends you'll be in for a world of fun with about 2-3 seconds worth of input delay that makes the game nearly unplayable. They also do nothing to Superstar or Franchise mode so they're barely worth even looking at. Just another fucking stinker by EA. I guess that shouldn't surprise anyone though considering that Madden is probably just some experiment conducted by the government to see if zoo animals are smart enough to code a functioning game. And while I'm at it too I'll say that this is a ridiculously disrespectful way to honor John Madden. Please stop making him roll over in his grave with this series and just end it or just call it "Football Game _". I guess the one good thing about this game is that I'd rather take my fat ass outside and touch grass before I load this shit up again so thanks for that EA. Maybe that was their plan all along. Just make a really shit game to encourage people to actually go outside or something. But that's just speculation and they're probably not smart enough to do that anyway! Now that I'm done ranting I hope the people that read this pick something up from my review and save themselves some money cause I sure as hell didn't. But yeah fuck madden and fuck EA. You're better off playing fortnite or minecraft or whatever the fuck people play. 0/10.

Let me preface by saying I haven't played a Madden game in over 10 years. Decided to finally give this one a shot despite the many poor reviews from people who buy this every single year. Overall, there are legitimately some great aspects to the game and I really wanted to like it but unfortunately the bugs and issues just completely outweigh any semblance of a good game. 

1) The whole progressive fatigue/auto sub thing is just game breaking. Even with progressive fatigue turned off, my week 18 game subs out all of my starters after the first play. If i sim a play, they come back but then are gone after the next play again. I have tried countless "fixes" but can't for the life of me get my starters to play the games at random times. No point to play the game if you can't even get it to put your correct players on the field

2) FAR too turnovers. Its like EA decided that every game would have 4-5 turnovers collectively and require one team to have a 2 minute offense for a chance to win the game. Just completely breaks the immersion of the game when a cornerback on another WR and whose back is to the QB will immediately turn around and cover 15 yards to a contested INT. Not fun when they advertise "smarter AI" CPU when all that really means is the CPU has a hive mind. People who would be considered wide open in an actual NFL game are consistently INT throws.

3) Gameplay sliders as an attempt to fix the issues above just simply don't work (minimal impacts on the game)

There are countless other issues with the game, like weak tackling, dumb blocking due to animations, etc. Sucks that such a fun sport has its game held hostage by an EA monopoly.

You HAVE to be logged into the EA app in order for any of your progress to be saved. And the EA app only works about 10% of the time. Not to mention the hours that you'll spend in loading screens instead of playing the game. This is awful. I'd get a refund if I could.

Madden NFL 24 has truly raised the bar for sports simulation gaming, delivering an exhilarating and immersive experience for football enthusiasts. The game boasts stunning graphics that bring the gridiron to life with incredible detail, capturing the essence of the NFL like never before. The gameplay is smooth, responsive, and authentic, allowing players to feel the adrenaline of every pass, tackle, and touchdown.

One of the standout features of Madden NFL 24 is its realistic player animations and movements, making it feel like you're controlling real NFL superstars on the field. The attention to detail in player models, stadiums, and crowd reactions adds a level of realism that enhances the overall gaming experience. Whether you're a seasoned Madden player or a newcomer to the franchise, the game offers a variety of modes and difficulty levels to cater to all skill levels.

The depth of the franchise mode is particularly impressive, allowing players to take control of their favorite NFL team and guide them through multiple seasons. The strategic aspects of team management, drafting, and player development add layers of complexity, making each season a unique and engaging challenge.

Madden NFL 24 also excels in its online multiplayer features, providing a platform for players to compete against friends or other gamers worldwide. The online community adds a social aspect to the game, fostering friendly competition and camaraderie among football fans.

In addition to its gameplay and graphics, Madden NFL 24 delivers an outstanding soundtrack that complements the intensity of on-field action. The carefully curated music enhances the overall atmosphere, creating an immersive environment that draws players deeper into the world of virtual football.

Overall, Madden NFL 24 is a triumph in sports gaming, combining cutting-edge technology with a deep appreciation for the sport. It's a must-play for football enthusiasts and gamers alike, offering an unparalleled and enjoyable simulation of the NFL experience.

First and last time I've touched a Madden game in decades. It's technical issues make it unplayable. 

-85% CPU use for no reason at UHD with an i9 9900k at 4.7 GHz stock turbo clock.
-Freezing randomly.
-STUTTERING. THE STUTTERING! Anytime you try to evade or make a catch the game just randomly skips frames and stutters making precision inputs impossible to control.
-Poor graphical optimisation. 70 fps with an RTX 4090 at 4K with 85% CPU use....
-Secure boot in BIOS required. Something your operating system doesn't require. This is going to cause issues on older machines or non-technical users. Instead of actually patching the issue, they simply send out a quiet news article that doesn't even explain how to do it. This is terrible! What next, am I going to require a third-party TPM module and USB key to play my $100 AUD game??
-Tutorials are terrible for new players. You'll be left wondering what actually went wrong in the drill which makes it very difficult to learn. Turns out I was performing a hit stick perfectly, but the players weren't lined up. So my guy just didn't have the size against the player he was up against, swapped teams and it landed everytime... this is silly when you're just trying to learn the mechanics. Or at least give you a 'pass' for performing the move correctly even if the outcome was unsuccessful on a technicality...

Now many people complaining about previous iterations, well I can't comment on that as I haven't touched a PC version in years. But if this is reflective of previous games, it's justified.

EA, you are still the same shocking company from the 90's. What's worse is gaming is so high profile now that the NFL will sell the licence to them all because of the money.

Edit: Well it's the end of the season and not a single god damn thing was fixed.

I'm a Franchise-mode enthusiast (dating all the way back to when EA Sports first got the exclusive license), I don't touch MUT or online multiplayer. There are some editions of Madden that I played for several hundred hours, including >5 full seasons of Franchise, doing excel sheets to run my draft. There's not much to say that hasn't already been said by other long-time Madden players ("fans" is the wrong word) -- the pace of progress from year-to-year is just incredibly frustrating. 

The gameplay *HAS* gotten better over the last 10 years. the movement is more fluid and realistic, the pass defense AI is smarter and plays the ball in the air more realistically, the run blocking is smarter, and the tools for controlling your team, pre- and-post snap, have gradually expanded to give more control, in satisfying ways.  The problem is (a) it's been *so* incremental from year to year, and (b) the experience outside of the gameplay hasn't gotten better *at all*. Both with the presentation elements of the game (the interstitial stuff, the UI of the graphics on the screen, the play-by-play calls), and with the menus outside of the game (which are terribly designed, with way too many layers, and that are infuriatingly slow to navigate). Over the years they've tried a lot of different ideas with roster management (draft, trades, depth chart, etc...), and it's just never gotten better. I think this may actually be worse than it was 10 years ago. This could be so crisp and fast with modern hardware, especially on PC, and instead it's just maddeningly sluggish, and important information is buried 8 layers deep in menus.

I'm not going to pretend it doesn't scratch an itch, as a football fan. Making the correct reads and playcalls to dice up a defence is fantastically satisfying. Chasing down a quarterback for a sack triggers an irresistible fist pump. Being in a tight game and trying to orchestrate a game-winning or game-tying drive as the clock ticks down is thrilling. Just a value-for-money issue when they keep re-releasing this game every year at full price.

I know I'm in the minority, but I enjoy the game.  if you stick to superstar and franchise, I think the game is a solid 8/10.  However, it all falls apart in MUT and online.  MUT is straight pay to win, nothing new there, has been that way for years.  Online is probably the most unfun thing I've ever played, full of sweats who spam the same 3 broken plays over and over again, hurry up offense, etc.  It got so bad that they had to add an option in group franchises to where you can disable people calling the same play over and over to prevent this, but it isn't present in quickplay online so whats the point.

Overall, if you're a football enthusiast and want to make your own player, or manage a franchise this game is worth the money.  If you got it to play online I think you should save your money.

I see a lot of people complaining about how overpowered the defenses are, and compared to historic Madden games they are very, very strong, but realistic. Also, after awhile you find a team and playbook that works for you, and you can become difficult to stop on offense. This game actually allows less cheese-plays than previous titles, and both zone and man coverage have weaknesses you can exploit naturally, as in real football. However, as a previous top ranked Madden player, I think Madden is mostly going in the exact wrong direction for the average player. The controls are clunkier than ever, and the play is less-arcadelike than ever. The fact is, Madden should not be a simulation type sports game. The whole concept of switching and playing players is unrealistic. If we think back to the sports games that were a blast - Griffey Baseball on N64, NHL 95 and NFL 95 of Genesis, NFL Blitz and NBA Street, they put fun first and sought to appeal to the average sports fan, and not the top 0.1% of players who want to play the game in an esoteric fashion. I expect Madden to continue to lose fans. Furthermore, the commentary and graphics are nearly unchanged from even Madden 18. The animations are better, but also more exploitable than ever before. This is not a game you can invite your buddy over for and fan some fun with for a few hours with beers, your average sportsbro just won't get it and will get wrecked and have a bad time. I only recommend the game because I personally enjoy playing at the top end of the player base and I like how they made it more about strategy and a little less about animation exploits and cheese plays. I am disappointed that it's most a roster update and the gameplay is not something I'd excitedly bring my friends to. EA having an exclusive right to the NFL license, I am hoping someone can replicate Retrobowl's success and make a game more akin to NFL Blitz or older Madden titles, but with modern graphics. I would not mind if they could not use official team or player names. Madden also seems to lose features with each release. You have to reset your playbooks now every time you start a new game or log in. For example, if I select the Pats offense and the Bills defense for playbooks, every time I start a new game I have to manually select those if I am playing as say, the Bucs. Mind you, this is a franchise that used to let you play as NFL Europe teams and see what uniforms looked like when selecting them...  I never mess with MUT because it is an amoral money pit, never have, so I cannot review that part of the game. My recommendation is to stick to franchise play, or online head to head. This game is purely for the Madden superfan who plays the game every year and a high level. I was going to skip it this year, but I had the football itch and it was only $25 on Christmas.

I'm only really playing this for franchise mode, and it's decent, but nowhere near perfect. There needs to be a mode or a setting where you can build a roster from scratch with the players you want, not make them punters and then trade for them. It would also be nice to play an older version of your team so you can build up to the present and not build into the future (playing as the 2017 Bills instead of the 2023 Bills). Fatigue should NOT be so high when you sim games/weeks and not actually play them. It sucks when your star players are fatigued and you simmed a lot of the games they played in. The gameplay itself could be better. It would be nice to have a designated button to switch between players on defense. Playing routes on offense or running the ball needs to be better because there will be a clean hole and then it closes as soon as your player enters.

I'm returning the game after less than 30 minutes of game time. This game looks much better that the last madden i bought (2008) but it is optimized so poorly, it should be considered a disgrace to EA. I bought this because it was on sale for $27 and i feel more ripped off than the 4th time i bought Skyrim at full price. If it ever drops to under $10, it might be worth it. I read a bunch of mixed reviews saying various things about it but one common thing was people complaining about the lack of new stuff. I thought since i hadn't played a Madden title in 16 years that I would be surprised by a few new things and not experience the same disappointment. But damn, a new mode designed to extract micro-transactions and a new engine (new for me, it came out in 2017 apparently) that feels like the old engine. I suppose one new feature is you can choose specialties for your team to focus on before the game (run middle, run outside, short, medium, or long pass) but then there's downsides to it too (focusing run middle makes your o-line better at that but worse at picking up blocks on the outside), this seems cool but at first until you realize there is no option to skip this choice all together meaning you have to choose a strategy that your AI controlled teammates will more or less automatically fail at. On top of all that, there's a weird bug that I experienced in the 2 games I played before refunding, after selecting teams and starting to load the game, it would automatically move my controller back to "no team" (idk what the proper term for this is but it would take me off my team and I would have to open the start menu and reassign myself to my team) which is not only annoying but since the game automatically readies up the opening kick off now (there's no coin flip in game, you decide all that while choosing teams focus, playbook, and jerseys now, for some reason) you can pause the game and select your team but the teams already have lined up for the kickoff and the game says "the effect will take place after the current play" which means there is no way (at least on pc in exhibition mode) that you can play the opening kick off. I know that 1 play is small in the grand scheme of a whole game but come on, how can this be in the game in December, so long after release. I bought this game because I was dying to play a football game, I never played as much of Madden as I did the NCAA series and I was hoping this would scratch that itch, now I'm left hoping that EA never releases that NCAA game they said they were going to do again because I'm sure that despite once being my favorite game series, it will be a disappointment now.

But! I had a hard time getting M24 to work at all! All most refunded. Direct x crash on first start. Followed by the game refusing to start at all for hours. Until I remembered EA is a terrible company and their game infrastructure sucks! 

I pushed though the pain because I’m stubborn and I have been here before. Not my first EA debacle. 

After hours of troubleshooting and no online solutions working, I decided to take matters into my own hands. I thought hard and went old school on it. 

Anyone having issues with the game crashing on start, LISTEN UP.!!!

Uninstall everything. 

MADDEN
EA APP
EAC
DELETE ALL FILES ALL 3 in docs and app data. 

RESTART 

*DISCLAIMER*
Disable anti virus. Window defender is fine to keep. In fact if you’re just a gamer and not downloading dumb shit, there is no need for any anti virus, windows defender is good enough and all you’ll ever need. 


Download EA app from your browser.
 
Download EAC from your browser
(Do nothing else from this step) 

Run Steam and install Madden on Steam. 

(Take note that I have 4 drives, one for my OS exclusively and all apps)
(HDD is for non demanding offline games)
(Two SSDs for online demanding games. I know a lot of you don’t have this set up but… Well… Do better 🤷🏻‍♂️)


OPEN EAC and INSTALL TO MADEEN.

Play and profit. 

If this works… your welcome
If not, you either didn’t follow directions (quite possible)

Or

You have an inferior rig, do better in life.

In short, Madden NFL 24 is not good enough and just isn't worth even the 60% discount. 

== Gameplay ==

Gameplay is improved this year, the game does play better, but the overall modes are lackluster. Running the ball actually feels more fun than in years passed.

The passing controls overhaul has been an interesting add to the strategy of the game when it works correctly. Essentially you can either control the power or accuracy of your passes, and also control the placement of your passes. When it works, it add a rewarding element to offensive play. However, there are several instances of passes going haywire that are labelled as perfect accuracy or perfect power (depending on your control scheme), this occurs due to Madden NFL 24's animations. But overall, this is probably the highlight of this year's game to me.

The AI tweaks to offensive line play makes the game play better if you actually know how to utilize it (you have to avoid pressing the triggers on snapping the ball and also step up into the pocket when appropriate), it actually is starting to resemble real football, which is an incredibly low-bar. 

The gameplay tweaks are probably the best part of Madden NFL 24, and that's huge for a football game. However, it's still behind even earlier games in this series and the occasional issues related to passing makes this feel like 1.5 steps forward. 

For a series with this patient userbase, it should be ridiculed that the best EA can do is a marginal step forward. And this is the best part of the game. 

== Modes ==

And this is where Madden NFL 24 truly falls off the rails. In short, the modes are barren. Madden NFL 24 has to remember that it isn't just competing with sports games, it's competing with all video games. And the package that players get for up to $69.99 is just subpar. 

Superstar mode, which got an overhaul from last year's Face of the Franchise, is subpar and loses most of its bells and whistles after the first season. The Maddencast concept provides interesting ideas but doesn't go beyond a novelty. The NFL Combine is an interesting add, but its only in the mode at the start of the player's career and takes 10 minutes. 

Franchise mode still pales in comparison to other sports games such as EA's NHL series, Sony San Diego's MLB The Show series, and especially NBA 2k. The big addition to Franchise mode this year is an extra trade slot and more draft pick trading, which tells you the level of effort (or lack thereof) that went into the mode. 

Mini-games are back for the first time since Madden 11, and they're incredibly milquetoast, banal, dull, lifeless. And in Superstar and Franchise mode, they're used for player XP. So in franchise, expect to do these boring modes over-and-over. I wish EA had made it like EA Sports FC's training in manager career, where you only had to do it ONCE and you could sim with the same level of reward. 

Ultimate Team is a cynical cash-grab that no one should play, but if you did want to play this gambling simulator, you should know that online performance in this game is horrendous. 


== Performance == 

This game is just not well optimized for the PC.

Routine issues with CPU management is a constant issue for this game. Frame skipping is a problem, and it's basically a necessity to put frame locks on (usually 120) and turn VSync off. 

It's so bad that I think EA should make the frame locks and VSync off a default.  

I would love to see Digital Foundry make a video about Madden NFL 24 because it would be scathing. I just lack the specific jargon to explain why this game performs so poorly. 

Stadiums with lighting effects such as fireworks may also occasionally dim the game's lighting to practically dim. Resource management is a nightmare.



== Online ==

This game is fundamentally unplayable online. The game regularly goes into what I call "slow mo" football when playing against players online, which makes Online H2H, Ultimate Team and especially Superstar Showdown virtually unplayable for most players. 

For reference, my internet speed is about 300 mbps down and 30 mbps up. And while that is unimpressive, it is more than enough for an online game in 2023/24.

If any part of you wants to buy this game play online, do not. I strongly recommend not buying this game if online gameplay is the biggest selling point for you. 

== Graphics and other visual details == 

This is the first year that Madden has had raytracing on the PC version of the game, and honestly, it's nothing to write home about. The performance tradeoff is simply not worth it. If the game was better optimized, then I'd consider trying it more. But otherwise, meh. 

"Sapien" technology, EA's corporate phrase relating to the skeletal meshes of player models in this game, is better than in years past and makes players look more true to form. But it looks horrendous on offensive linemen. And for players who lack scans, it doesn't add much "authenticity" to the game. 

== Overall == 

Madden NFL 24 is the equivalent of a team starting at their own 25, getting to the redzone, and throwing an interception. It's a game with a few interesting additions, interesting bells and whistles that are brought down by its snoozefest game modes, its performance issues on the PC, and its unacceptable online performance. 

The only way I could recommend someone Madden NFL 24 is if they only wanted to play single player play now and nothing else. 

It's unfortunate how bad the state of Sports games are these days especially as we've seen incredible games come out in 2023, but that's the fun of exclusive licenses. 

(Grade Scale: A+, A, A-, B+, B, B-, C+, C, C-, D+, D, D-, F)

Honest Review - TL;DR - 2/10

I have bought Madden since about Madden 02, when I was 11 years old. I always just made do with whatever they added or took away from the game. It was never really anything to gripe about. They added features that were really cool, and took away things that I was upset because it was fun.

I can officially say, that buying every single Madden has come to an end for me. I will not be purchasing Madden beyond this year. The developers have officially lost my trust and are now in the category of "Money Hungry".

The game-play itself, I have to admit, is very bad. The animations are not better from last year, they're about the same, if not worse at some instances. I play mostly Offline Franchise, so I can only really speak on those features, and they didn't really improve from last year. The addition of the Training Camp Mini-Games is very nice, that was a fresh addition, but other than that, it's the same Franchise mode from last year. 

The animations are very bad, as far as throwing the ball to any receiver, you either lead them too far and it gets intercepted, or you under throw them, and it gets intercepted. The running game in Madden is more or less the same, blockers barely block, the CPU D-Line just barrels through and gets you for a short gain, or causes a fumble.

The player editing (which I always did for draft picks in franchise) has completely deterred me from playing this game, this is what did it for me. They made it so just editing a players helmet takes about 4-5 minutes, rather than 2-3 seconds from previous years. Just editing a player now takes 4-5 minutes (that is not an exaggeration), and it takes all the fun of just setting your new draft picks in some actual proper gear and make them look like real players. 

All in all, I would give this game a 2/10, there are so many things I would change, animations, editing players, franchise mode salary caps, AI field sense and real game feel. 

This franchise has lost a true fan for more than 20 years. 

I am excited for NCAA when it comes out in summer of 2024, but I am cautiously optimistic because of EA.

The promise of an overhauled game raised our hopes, but the reality is a crushing letdown. The game's online play, a crucial aspect for any modern title, is a mess. It's as if the developers completely ignored the evolution of online gaming over the past decade. The experience is plagued with issues that make it feel like we're still stuck in the early 2010s.

Madden 2024's AI, especially in the trenches, is a mixed bag. While playing against All-Pro AI can sometimes offer a semblance of challenge and strategy, it's overshadowed by the glaring flaws that emerge once you take the game online. The online gameplay is not just disappointing; it's frustratingly unrealistic. It's a far cry from the authentic football experience we were promised.

The game mechanics feel outdated, and the lack of innovation is apparent. It's as if the developers decided to play it safe, rehashing old ideas instead of bringing something fresh to the table. The graphics and animations, while slightly improved, don't compensate for the game's fundamental flaws.

In conclusion, Madden 2024 is a stark reminder that a new contract doesn't always lead to better outcomes.

First of all, overall a pretty good game if you’re into football and wanna experience it yourself. 
But if you start playing and go deeper into playing you’ll start to notice all the things that’ve gone wrong with the programming. When you play Superstar WR Mode (without Home Field Advantage) on Pro it’s way to easy, nearly every 2nd catch is a big one and you get TD after TD while winning every game 35:12 or something. But when you put it one Difficulty up to All-Pro it becomes hell, because then it gets unplayable. Not because the defense is better or is blocking you better, but because of so many unrealistic things that happen again and again that make you wanna quit the game. 
Your QB starts to throw an completely unrealistic amount of Interceptions (Mahomes threw 5 INTs in the first half to my other teammates, the other QB of course threw not even one). Your teammates seem to drop the ball every two seconds in the redzone too, if it isn’t an interception in the first place. And you lose the ball every two seconds because it’ll get knocked out of your hands or your QB underthrows the ball a couple of yards and just hammers it into the ground in a direction you weren’t even running, like he badly miscalculated the ball. 
So at the end of the game I had 350 passing yards and one TD because of 5 INTs in the redzone (and a missed field goal and extra point), the other team had 80 passing yards and won because of two TDs and a field goal. Also you miss like 50 or 60 Percent of your Field Goals and Extra Points, while the enemy team barely misses anything. 
So instead of making the defenders just do a better job they make your QB throw complete shit to stop you that way, like they want to mess with you and make you angry. 
And I didn’t even mention all the times your teammates just ran into you and were stuck with you for a couple of second, so you couldn’t catch your ball because of errors in the programming. 
I still recommend the game because it is a lot of fun playing, but only if you get the difficulties and settings right.

Introducing mechanics for precision passing based off of timing and anticipation, but not ensuring your game registers button inputs is a bold choice. It doesn't matter if you're in menus or on the field, the game will simply not register inputs from controller 10% of the time. Another bug causes sound to be echoed forever, getting louder and louder until you restart the game. While the passing and momentum mechanics are a fun add, and it's nice to have some combine minigames from decades old games reintroduced, none of it makes up for how poorly optimized this game is, and how poorly it runs.

This games is straight up terrible and not for the classic "same thing as always" reasons. Ultimately what do people expect? It's football. It won't change much over time. The one thing about a football game that should get better though is player physics and AI intelligence.

And well.. The AI and throwing mechanics are simply horrific. The bullet vs touch vs lob pass controls are extremely inconsistent, or if they aren't inconsistent they are so precise that it feels like you're playing more of a rhythm game than a football game.

Meanwhile as you struggle to comprehend how to correctly throw a pass the way you want at any given moment the AI is terrible. Your guys will just consistently blow their routes on offense. Meanwhile the defensive AI is capable of basically immediately getting to every ball they possibly can. Worse yet there seems to be some unexplained or just bad programming on receivers where they drop or have passes knocked loose extraordinary often. Even if they are passes that would otherwise be caught with ease, even while contacted in the NFL.

Awful game and physics mechanics make what should be the most fun part of football at best complete boring, at worse extremely frustrating. Dropping back to pass feels like a crap shoot every time.

It is night and day playing this game vs FC24. FC24 isn't perfect but the actual games feel fun and like they've got a high skill ceiling, this is a dice roll.

It's Madden. Not much else I can say. We are essentially paying for a roster update, as we have been for years at this point. Though I will point out that with next gen finally on PC, we are heading in the right direction. 
    I'm really only interested in franchise, so I can't comment on any other game modes as of this writing. I do appreciate that they seem to be TRYING to improve, with certain aspects of franchise mode upgraded. As far as a franchise/sim experience goes, I would say this is the best in many years.
    As for the gameplay- meh. It's vastly improved from 22/23, thanks in large part to the next gen features. However, it still leaves much to be desired. The sliders take some SERIOUS tweaking to even make playing the game enjoyable. Running the ball is fine- passing, however, is virtually IMPOSSIBLE. If you like throwing 40 interceptions in a season, this is for you. 
    The new passing mechanics, while I appreciate what they're trying to accomplish- are just bad. One of the reasons I feel Madden has been in decline the past decade or so is because they always seem to be "fixing" things that aren't broken. Give me classic, simplistic gameplay controls, and put work into features that matter to make the game more engaging. Just my opinion.
    Overall, if you're a longtime fan of the series as I am, and particularly just enjoy burning time managing a franchise, it's worth the money if you can get it on sale. Here's hoping it's a step in the right direction and they continue to improve.

Here is my take from a 39 year old who grew up loving the jets on N64 with Curtis Martin and the Z button being the Juke move that broke players ankles like crazy and then played most Maddens until 2016 then stopped mainly because  they put in designing your own plays and having your own playbooks then stopped that.

Some things you must know.  
1.) i rarely play it online
2.) Ultimate team is not something i get into because it just feels like those PTW "free" games on a mobile ap that means whoever has the biggest wallet wins.  
3.) i enjoy playing franchise mode
4.) i play on simulation
5.) I dont use the sticks for much of the hitting or ball placements except in rare occasions as its just to much to relearn all the time 

Its a solid football game.    Its far from perfect and there can be a lot of things that could be improved, but its got the players in the NFL, its got stats, whether you agree with them or not is subjective, tit plays well.  I run the game on my laptop and i use my Refurbished deck, which the only reason i even got it was the sale price and the additional 20% refurbished version was a steal for this madden game.  I do have to run it in streaming mode but once i run it in streaming mode the deck controls work perfectly and its fantastic.  Now if they made it work fully just on the Deck Alone... i feel like they might hit another market out there.   

I say all this so you understand, i run the game on my LAPTOP gaming computer with 16 gigs of ram a 3050 and a I5 CPU, that streams the game to my Deck and i just turn the deck to 10 fps and watts to use it as a controller only and get 6-8 hours of battery off of it and watch the game on my laptop or use an HDMI cord to plus the laptop into the TV and play it that way.   

I don't experience input lag, in fact this is the first madden in such a long time i can remember enjoying the running game A LOT in.  Blockers picking up blocks is a huge thing.  Having a shitty blocker in front of you with bad awareness or run block stats is really noticeable.   (Makes me really wish they would put more love in to the full backs so that they would be as effective as they are in game but small gripe)   The running in the game is just crisp.  the days of tacklers just brushing against you to tackle you while engaged must have stopped a while ago.  The holes open and close in zone running schemes in ways that feel like you can pick the hole and run through.  

The passing can seem pretty interesting as i have seen line backers vary their depth against the same play, albeit very rarely but  i have seen it, and the speed of receivers and route running ability is still pretty damn paramount.  I quite enjoy taking the game, and just playing it.  Its not a game i want to buy at 70$ USD, honestly id buy it at launch if they made the single player game 30 or 40$ USD at launch and sold the multiplayer separately.  Madden to me is best played in the house with people around so that if you want to talk shit or be bitter you have to do it face to face.  Want to try to run out the clock?  take the verbal barbs of being called all kinds of names for "not playing the game".  

This game is not transcendent or some kind of perfect football game by any means but for fans of teams... especially those teams that are not playing great in a  season it certainly quenches the thirst for sure.  I wont bu the game at full price  maybe ever again, but all these reviews that say its terrible?  Just don't buy it for a few years and keep playing the same one, eventually the game will feel good again.  Its not an every year purchase unless you want to chase that ultimate team money sink...

eh, its fine. some minor improvements over past maddens I've played but the problems that have been there are still there. for reference, I mainly play PvP online and  simulation mode against the computer, I don't really play much with make-a-player or franchise mode or any of that stuff. The only other maddens I've played are '07 and '21. 

great:
- presentation is great and graphics look good. commentary is quite accurate and sounds great.

good:
- menu system is fine
- ball handling controls etc. are good overall. feels ok to run with the ball and is relatively responsive except when getting tackled from behind..
- the momentum mechanic that messes with routes/buttons/shakes camera is interesting and a fun new part of the game
- coach play calling is good and tends to do "more of whats working", and is generally situationally aware
- team ratings, player ratings, and superstars make the game more fun and seem more accurate. a lot of positions matter and having good o-line makes running offense easier, while having good d line causes confusion and mayhem for offenses. overall, well done

meh:
- tackling animations have been improved and now there is a momentum-like system that makes the tackles bearable. still not great, but its fine and an improvement over the older maddens ive played
- the skill passing mechanic is interesting but frustrating. sort of a good first step in the right direction but i still prefer classic passing
- adjusting cpu skill in settings takes care of some of the issues and makes the game more playable

bad:
- qb scrambles cause the AI to totally lose its mind, causing some lbs to watch QBs run for 50+yds or tds because they are stuck in their zone and seemingly unable to leave.
- blockers will just randomly miss blocks on defenders 5 inches away from them
- similarly, AI defenders will miss tackles in similar fashion. there is not a good "proximity" system for determining whether players should be hit, slowed down, or missed
- with no more qb vision it makes the passing seem more random and less skill based. maybe there is a way to enable it but i have not found it

horrendous:
- player ball tracking/catching (for passing) is horrendous. your receivers might just watch a ball sail 2 feet from their face while a db right behind them steals it away. other times players will simply not be looking when they should be and the ball will hit them in the back of the head. other times your receiver will make impossible grabs in quadruple coverage with 2dbs in front of them. other times dbs will get sucked to the ball from 10 yards away to swat the ball away. overall, 50% of the time passing just feels like total BS, no matter if you throw a horrendous interception or perfect TD. it doesnt feel right. 
- coach suggestions for playmaking just make NO sense and seem to repeat the same 5 plays over and over and over.


----

I guess if you can get it for like $10 get it. I have unfortunately played it more than the return window allows so I'm stuck with it. Probably don't pay more than $20 for it, especially if you have madden from the previous ~5 years

Madden just sucks. They do nothing to fix their game year after year. I didn't buy last year but did this year and I don't know why people like me keep falling for it. I've had multiple games (franchise mode/franchise player) where I win the game, press "finish game" and it doesn't load or crashes and the game results are not recorded. Offensive line play is horrendous and does not represent actual offensive line play. I can't find an offensive lineman in the NFL that won't get on his block and just stay at the line of scrimmage blocking the hole that the runningback needs to get through. Their is no AI intelligence whatsoever. If you ever rushed to get a play off before quarter 1 or 3 or even the 2 minute warning, you know its a crap shoot. You break huddle and have 5 seconds before one of those comes up? Not enough time. Even though line and receivers are set, the QB needs to do some stupid animation where he looks at the defense and just mozies on along like you aren't racing the clock to get one more play before you can't. Your player getting sucked into an animation where the defender isn't around you but you suddenly get sucked back a yard or two for the sake of the animation. The game is pathetic and a sorry excuse for football "simulation." Save your money

Madden 24 itself is a super fun game, but there are a few important things to note and reasons why you should NOT buy it. 

1. The auction hub for PC is separate than Playstation or Xbox. On PC there is a smaller player base and therefore less players to complete sets, find players if you want to build an NFL team themed team which boosts player stats. I've also encountered a few cheaters on the game who use this pause glitch where you sit on the pause screen for an indefinite amount of time... happened in my super bowl which was awesome. 

2. This is the most important thing to note is that MADDEN RUNS HORRIBLE ON PC with Steam. I didn't do enough research into the specific reasons behind it, but there is an issue with connecting your Steam account to EA which means your game literally cannot launch. I've been trying for two days to launch it, have gone through a dozen different reddit recommendations and nothing. 

I'm currently writing this review while talking to Vaishali with EA support. It feels like you're talking to Chat GPT, they take 5 minutes to reply and do nothing useful. Waste of money.

As much as I love Madden... this is an absolute mess. The constant in-game freezes/lag spikes. The game crashes and lock-ups. The cpu being allowed to completely destroy you in "mini-drills" and during the game, completely ignoring any sort of rules that SHOULD exist in the NFL. (Have literally had my receivers mugged play after play and not a single flag). Weird sub selections where you end up with personnel that have no right to be in a position playing it because the cpu doesn't care what you want (Linemen playing WR anyone?). There is so much more wrong with this game that make absolutely no sense. There are even parts of the game that I am completely unable to play because every time I do it just permanently hangs on loading, even if I validate the files 'cause apparently it's supposed to be broken (Superstar Mode). Will I still play the game? Yup. Why? Because there isn't any decent alternative yet. Will I buy the next one... Probably, because I'm a sucker and love football too much. I definitely won't be happy, nor will I be buying it anywhere near the launch price.

This is pathetic. 

For context; I enjoy this game. This is the first Madden title I've purchased. I've played nearly 35 hours in 2 weeks of getting this (I really, really enjoy this game). 

However, the during-play lag spikes and FPS slowdowns are too much to deal with. This wasn't a problem for the first two weeks of my playing of this game. This problem started around two days ago, and I haven't found a way to fix this. 

For a company like EA, this is expected. But it's incredibly frustrating to deal with, especially since it means that this game is now, for all intents and purposes, unplayable, but I won't be able to receive a refund due to the hours I've played and the time since initial purchase.

All of which is to say; this is pathetic.

I love NFL and football but this game shouldn't exist it's so bad.

Currently I was attempting "competitive play"  which means run the most broken things you can find, use the cheapest plays/players, and adapt as ea continues to ruin the game every "patch"

IT's so bad in it's current state that you can't progress in the game if you have one of the literal hundreds of bugs in the game.  

Right now if you play Seasons in H2H mode to earn packs the only way you can stay competitive in NMS... The seasons won't reset.  You can lose 3 which would usually reset, it won't do anything, you can win 5 which should take you to playoffs... it won't.  You're stuck getting 5k coins a win and supposed to buy 1.5m + players to stay competitive.  Fun times. 

You go to EA help forums and see that it's been outsourced to India and the people you talk to have 0 ability to help do anything.

The game is a disgrace.  Even though I've qualified for tournaments, I'm quitting as the game and most of it's modes are actually broken broken.

There is no real "scene" other than 20-30 guys in a discord who all hate the game, yet can make a few thousand playing it on a "pro" level.  There is a reason no one watches or cares as most of the "pro" players are degens who have failed at everything else in life.  There is a reason the tournament and players got shot up , you connect the dots when you see the types of people who take a game this broken seriously. 


There are currently more people watching animal Crossing than there are madden on twitch.   Oh and if you want certain players? They make you register and watch the "competitive" MCS crap on twitch for hours to get said player.   These are just some of the wonderful tactics madden has used to boost temporary watch #'s, yet on average you can see no one cares, or will care about this game because at the end of the day, the game is trash.

The game is pay to win, there is no way around it.

IN the current promo "blitz" to 100% get a 93 LTD, the min price you pay is 200.00 Dollars.   Imagine paying over 3x the game price for a single player.


EA IS TRASH.   It can't be stated enough how awful they've become and how totally terrible Madden is.   Instead of making a competitive game, they milk the whales over and over again, so they have a little more speed, a little more ability to glitch blitz rushes, and this is the state of madden for as long as they can get away with it.  In this game the extra stats mean everything when your guy is 1 step ahead and you can make the 5-10 adjustments before every play to give them advantage.

I HIGHLY suspect the positive reviews on this game are bought and paid for by EA marketing.  There is no one who could seriously try to play this at a high rate and not run into 100's literally of bugs/glitches.   Kick meters being blocked? Been happening all year, they've done nothing to fix it.  "Can't connect to server to process game?"  This bug has lasted YEARS, yet is still happening. 

Mention a boycott/lawsuit/petition on ea help forums?  That equals a ban.  How dare people mention viable ways to put pressure on a game company that is soulless and doing every scummy thing in the book to hook kids on gambling while pushing a product that qualifies in my mind as fraudulent.  



TLDR ;  This game is TRASH, borderline fraud, and without the exclusive license from NFL wouldn't even still exist. 


Someone at EA needs to be held accountable for taking a product with so much potential and running it headfirst into the ground all while trying to milk the last drops of blood from whales / credit card carls / and mentally slow to play it.

Up until this year's game, I hated Madden. I was one of those people that played classic football games, like NFL 2k5. But as those games fade into the past more and more, I needed a modern football game to scratch the itch.

And that's where I think that Madden stands up to the moment. Is it perfect? No. But it's good enough to scratch the itch and provide entertainment. And franchise is so much better than in years past. I love the training mini games and the improved AI logic. Now it just needs to continue to improve gameplay and keep adding new stuff to franchise.

This may well be the poorest performing game I have ever had the displeasure of playing on steam. I would forgive this game if it simply ran poorly, because I play Star Citizen, I'm used to it, but it is the clear and present danger which this game poses to my PC hardware that has me requesting this refund today. I simply cannot continue to strangle my CPU when I have a glorious GPU that could easily run this game, yet for some ungodly reason, EA has decided NOT to run the game on the GPU, instead opting to run it off of my much older, much less cool, not as awesome CPU. For this I am eternally disgusted. I thought EA a foolish corporation, with an awful launcher, now I simply pity them, for being SO INCREDIBLY INEPT THAT THEY CANNOT PORT A GAME TO PC PROPERLY. This game is so bad for my PC and my heart that it has me consistently writing in run-on sentences, do with this information what you will. Thank you for your time.

Unless you are a hardcore Madden player, I recommend buying when on sale. There is plenty to do and actually worth the cost if you actively play. It is worth buying annually as an active player but understand the arguments against it as the changes are minimal at that frequency. If you are a competitive player and can play All-Madden, online PVP gaming is suggested. The online play and rosters only work for that season. 
You can buy cheaper American football games but this is definitely the best one available. The older Madden games get progressively cheaper for your budget.

IF YOU ARE HAVING FPS ISSUES NOT RELATED TO CPU USAGE:

This is a console to PC port, it is not optimized for high refresh rate. Turn off V-Sync and make sure your frame rate cap does not exceed your monitors refresh rate. Doing this got rid of all the annoying stutters and freezes I was having.

Prepare for handholding and babysitting.

No way to stop auto timeouts, softlocks the entire client every time a player levels up (any of your 50+, so after every game) requiring a restart, forces you to download the EA launcher so they can collect and sell your data, incorrect penalty and first down determinations, incorrect commentary, bad commentary, reused commentary from the last Madden I played (17). Poor AI management, so that they are always perfectly in a run blitz during a draw play, or stacking the flat on a sweep. 
When I played too well on regular, the game started spamming holding calls to slow me down.

 I lost a game because the AI wasted all of my timeouts without telling me, there's no way to change this. 
Horrendous clock management too- you have to watch entire 5 second animations play before you can snap the ball. Horrible no huddle calls, which still wastes 10-15 seconds (the real life average is below 5). Disabling any of this in settings doesn't work. The animations WILL play, and the clock WILL drain. No time outs either, because the AI auto wasted them in the 3rd quarter. 

After every 2nd play of the game, the game will force you into an "injuries update" animation where Charles Davis will say one of three possible lines about the "Next man up". My Franchise had players out for the season, meaning this will play 17+ times, unavoidably. 

Most of the game play is RNG to determine what animation plays. If a defensive lineman gets near your QB, a sack animation plays regardless of your input.  I was sacked multiple times by touching a blocked defensive lineman's ankle, because when his hitbox is touched it plays the sack animation regardless of context. 

The only redeeming quality is the passing itself can be fun, and I liked spamming play action bootlegs to roll out as Josh Allen, Mahomes, or CJ Stroud. 

Class action lawsuit tier, 0/10

Almost nothing about this game has changed except for adding Madden Ultimate Team, which the game CONSTANTLY begs you to play. First starting up the game? Unskippable screen telling you about MUT. It's beyond ridiculous.

I haven't bought a Madden game in a decade, and I'm still seeing more glitches in this game than there were on Madden 13 for the WiiU. The fucking WiiU. Sometimes simming practice in franchse mode will put you in loading screen purgatory where your only option is to close the game and reopen it (just to be greeted by another MUT ad, mind you). Still somehow don't have faces for some players and players who made their respective teams just straight up aren't in the game in any capacity.

Then there's the EA launcher app. Good lord, this thing is barely functional and is completely unecessary to begin with. As far as I'm concerned, this series is dead to me until EA loses the business, and there is absolutely nothing that can change that. No one should buy this game or the next $70 "update" that EA shits out with less than minimal effort. Unacceptable.

From an offline franchise player's perspective, this is quite possibly the worst sports game I have ever played (with some historical knowledge surrounding the franchise and publisher at least). I pick up Madden about once every 5 years because they have a monopoly on football games, and just about every single problem from the past is still alive and well, and with more to add to the collection.

Playing defense gets worse every year, the NFL is becoming more offensive so it is understandable, but I am genuinely concerned if a lot of these problems are actually design choices. I have watched defensive scheme videos out the ass, made coverage changes, made a defense with DBs that are 99 on every relevant attribute and they get cooked by no-names in man coverage on every other play, match coverage requires a bunch of workarounds to not leave about 2 players open by a margin of at least 10 yards. Pretty sure there is nearly an instant release bonus for any receiver with 90+ speed against press coverage. 
Blitzing is more cheese than football and taking advantage of how bad players get stuck on each other. Post-play animations are possibly the worst I have seen in recent years, and bumping into one of your lineman as a runner might as well call the play dead, you’re glued to them at that point.

Offensive schemes are based around manipulating AI or getting defensive players stuck on each other, which is not difficult in this game, but the CPU’s DBs and linebackers have superpowers compared to a player teams AI-controlled players to artificially increase the difficulty to mask how bad defense as a whole runs in this.

Franchise still has the same appearance as years ago, so they aren’t even changing superficial things which is wild to me. Contract negotiation is the only improvement I see present in the last 3-4 years of releases. Trading is insanely easy on the default difficulty (I admittedly haven’t toyed with the setting much at this point). Scouting is identical to how it was years ago, and it was unacceptably bad then. Commentators can’t or at least won’t say common names like “Harrison”, so after 2 or 3 years of decent drafts, 90% of game commentary is the generic filler dialogues, which if you can guess, are also the same as multiple years ago. Gear-wise, rookies are not set to follow any form of trend from the looks of things- little 5’10 wideouts wearing linebacker facemasks, a lot of loose sleeves and tall pads, which might just be funky to me, but I’m already complaining, so fuck it.

I have tried modding the game, and it makes the game a bit more tolerable. However, games (ESPECIALLY FULL-PRICED AAA GAMES THAT HAVE A LOCK ON THE ENTIRE COMPETING MARKET) shouldn’t feel like an experience that you tolerate. I don’t think that is a wild statement and will guarantee those who disagree are reliant on Madden having a concurrent playerbase for their own security, profit, or genuinely need a copium intervention. This is an issue that is much larger than the unfortunate result that Madden happens to represent remarkably well, but this one pissed me off while I had a lot of free time.

It is almost lost on me at this point that in order to even play this game, I had to troubleshoot controller issues and EA app issues for multiple hours. A majority of issues I have tried to troubleshoot have been rabbit holes that haven’t answered my questions, but have shown me that these issues have been ongoing for a minimum of 3 years/releases. These are structural issues, these are not nitpicky issues. Everything that is wrong in the gaming industry is on full display with this game, and I presume all the other years I steered clear of the franchise. Please, for the love god, stop buying this MUT shit if you are committed to playing sim-style football games. EA can pay the NFL to re-release this garbage every year, and it is not just the fat cat upper management at EA’s fault that this trend has been going on in the gaming industry as a whole.

TLDR: The whole meme of “EA just releases a roster update for $60 every year” is actually being generous to EA. Most updates are to player likeness, and they are banging those out at a rate that seems like they have one intern on the job. This is the worst game I have played in recent memory that didn't have routine stability concerns and crashes. This is not an acceptable product, not an acceptable business practice, and an insult to its own playerbase, and probably the developers that want to make a better game. Speak with your wallet, that's all they hear.

This game is good for the most part.

I was unsure if I should get it or not because of all the negative reviews, I'm not sure what they are experiencing that is so bad but this is my experience 40 hours in.

This game isn't 100% optimized for PC to say the least, obviously they prioritize optimization for consoles, but PC isn't terrible, on my laptop the game can be a bit laggy, it has a 1660Ti, but on my PC with a 3070Ti, it runs smooth as butter, but that being said, even on a very good PC, I can't run max graphics like I can with most other games, I have to run it on medium settings, which is a bit disappointing because I know it should be able to handle better than that.

I've experienced 2 glitches, I audibled to a blitz right before a snap and the Center hiked the ball way over the QBs head and out of the endzone, and after that it was just 2nd and 10 like nothing happened. Another was a TD celebration where the upright was in the way and the players were glitching around it.

Franchise mode is awesome, and the feature where you can download draft classes that other people have made is really cool.

I know people complain that Madden is always the same game every year, but they would complain more if it changed too much. I like how I can just pick up the newest Madden and be able to play it right away because the controls are pretty much the same and everything.

I'm having a good time playing the game at the end of the day, and you probably will too.

Even worse, they also have the audacity to blame the consumers of their product, the same people that make the company millions of dollars, for their game having issues.  Claiming that it is not the game itself and that it is actually the hardware that pc players are using.  I would genuinely never recommend this game to anybody else and I am absolutely reaching a breaking point before I stop playing altogether myself.  This is beyond aggravating and also just flat out tiring at this point.  All I want is to play the game I grew up with and enjoy the experience again.  I love football and always loved Madden games but that love is very quickly dissipating.

I'll start off by saying this is literally my first Madden purchase ever. I recently got into football (2021) and decided I may as well pick up a Madden game for fun and this one was half off despite only being a few months old. Thats a massive red flag, but honestly I'd say it was worth it.

I only play franchise and superstar modes, I'm not interested in h2h or MUT. So far the experience has been great. The game works well enough that I have an enjoyable time.

That said, this is not me recommending the game to you, the average Madden player. If you play these games a lot more than I do than I'm sure you'll run into infuriating issues nonstop. The other day I was unable to play superstar mode because I couldn't connect to the league (????) and so I had to either play a quick match or play nothing. I only loaded up madden to play this (what should be an offline) experience and I couldn't. Other things of note are that people constantly get stuck on each other and it just ruins the timings of routes and the expectations of where a receiver should be when the ball is thrown. This wouldn't be a problem if there was adequate feedback that they were stuck, but they continue whatever running animation they're in, but just stuck in place.

Overall I cannot recommend a yearly sports game. That's to be expected. If you keep letting EA and 2k defecate in your mouth and then start chewing after, they're going to continue making bad games. I just bought this game because I didn't have one already and I wanted a casual game I could play with my friend.

After playing Franchise for 150~ hours, it's safe to say that the further you get into the season, the more it feels every game is decided by a dice roll while you're loading in.

You will be able to score, but you'll never get closer than being down 7 for the win. You "outplayed"/cheesed the AI? Welllll, there's a holding flag or your star player is now out for the rest of the season. Got a scrambling QB? That 6'6" 320, 63 speed DT is faster and more agile than your 6'2" 205 94 speed QB/RB, he'll even phase through your O-Line because they physically do not exist as anything more than a dice roll.

If you're meant to lose the game, you won't win it. All-Pro or All-Madden. At least Sim Stats seem much better than they've been in the past, no more 20+ QBs passing for 4k+ in a season.
