I haven't played Madden in probably two years and wanted to give it a try. Didn't think it was possible, but Madden 24 is the worst Madden I've ever played.

- features like Progressive Fatigue don't work and have been buggy for 2-3 years
- you are forced to use the new passing because classic passing feels like your QB is blind
- the performance is horrible even with an RTX 4080
- there are features like dynamic momentum, which do not belong into a simulation (I mean are the players on crack or why is the camera starting to shake, passing routes going blurry, or the kicking meter is fading away?)
- the menus are slower than a granny in a wheelchair and full of useless animations which slow everything down even more
- the gameplay is scripted af, which means it's extremely difficult to get a win if the game doesn't want you to win (receivers are dropping every ball, the ball is landing out of reach even when thrown with perfect accuracy or being swatted away by the defense, pass rush will run you over like your O-line is on vacation etc.)

What EA delivers each year is absolutely embarrassing for the NFL. It would be great if another publisher could get this license to finally end this crap.

Ordinarily i wouldn't have anything to say about this game, but after reading a bunch of existing reviews and deciding to just say screw it and buying it, i feel i must share my perspective, in case anyone else out there is in a similar situation as i was.
I noticed fairly early on that like 80-90% of the negative reviews are from people who have bought every single iteration of the game for the last decade-plus. the last one i played was Madden 2000 for the Playstation 1 back when i was 6 years old. I have absolutely no frame of reference for all the little (again, to ME they're little) details with which most of them have complaints.
My friend and I were looking for non-shooter games we could play cross-platform PC to PS5, and since we've been watching more college and NFL games together and i've been teaching him the little i know about it, he said he'd like to try a football game. As luck would have it, this game gives us exactly what we were looking for - cross-platform football.
Is it a perfectly refined and polished game? no. sadly, very few games today are. some of the menus are a little laggy and unresponsive, and there are occasional moments where you have to ask yourself "just what the hell happened on that play?" but overall, i've been having a great deal of fun jumping back into the Madden franchise with this game.
If you're like me and haven't played a Madden game in a long time and are just looking to get back into some football, don't let the negative reviews put you off. It's a fully-functioning game, i haven't run into anything i could describe as "broken" yet. again, not perfect, but if you can nab this game at any kind of a discount i do believe it's worth it.

I know I'll be a minority voice in a sea of "This game is trash" but I am not having any of the technical issues other people seem to be having such as FPS drops, slow-mo plays after the snap, etc. So far the game has ran at a solid 140FPS for me without a single bug/glitch, although I am using a mid to high-end machine to run Madden 24 which I'm sure factors into the equation.

The new passing mechanics are pretty neat as they have become more skill-based, although the feature can be reverted to the original passing mechanics if you are more comfortable. The collision system feels more natural which adds to the immersion of the game as well.

My only complaint with the Madden series as a whole is that sometimes I wish they'd bring back QB vision. When playing as a DB, reading the QBs eyes and head movements are a crucial part to playing well and jumping routes but they cannot seem to translate this into any Madden game anymore as they had in the past.

Otherwise, this game shares a lot of similarity with the previous title so this will feel like a roster update with some new bells and whistles but overall I am enjoying the game. If you are a football fan, and your PC meets the preferred specs, I think you will enjoy it too.

I do not recommend this game if you want a realistic simulation of football. However, with simulation mode, and Matt10's sliders, the game is pretty fun. It's still way too animation-dependent, and the physics and logic needs updating, and inertia doesn't really exist (at least for AI defenders lol)... but... it's fun, I gotta say. The draft is pretty good, I like scouting, free agent period is interesting. Of the Madden's I played since 19, this is the best so far. 

I have found that there is a bit of a secret with having fun in franchise mode with this game. Don't play with your favorite team. I know, I know, that's the main reason most franchise players get the game - they want to mold their IRL favorite team into a dynasty. Trust me, the flaws in this game, such as hilariously awful QB accuracy on All-Madden, and superhuman cornerbacks who can turn off a route and undercut a receiver that they weren't even covering, are much more forgivable when you don't really know the team you're playing as. For example, my favorite team are the 49ers, and playing as Brock Purdy in this game, I'd have 15 interceptions by week 8, and most of them would be the game randomly deciding that Purdy is going to overthrow a slant by fifteen yards directly into the hands of a safety while under pressure from one guy. I've seen this guy hurl perfect passes with five guys in his face, but the game makes him look like a FCS QB. But, if I play on the Broncos, a team I don't know much about nor have any strong feelings towards, it suddenly stings much less when I throw 20 picks in a season.

Anyways, those are my two cents. The franchise mode non-gameplay stuff is pretty good and engaging now (I didn't even mention practice drills or minicamp, it's fine I guess, it gives you something to do if you're a sim-only player) and the gameplay is... passable. With Matt10 sliders. 

P.S. If you like to run a lot, rushing actually feels great this year.

[h1] 90% of this game is cut scenes and menu scrolling set to mundane hype music. [/h1]

Never played a Madden game, or any other NFL title. So if that's what it's supposed to be; then they nailed it. 

[b]The rate of play is slower than golf. [/b]  The game did a great job making a bunch or cut scenes between plays that mimic an NFL game. However I quickly found these displays arduous to sit through and started meeting them with the same patience of a YouTube ad and mashing the keyboard to skip. 

Clearly a lot of work went into this game and at its core, the football mechanics are stellar. It offers a lot of control and nuance that can be very satisfying when done correctly. The problem is that the whole game seems disjointed, unauthentic, and is trying too hard to mimic what football LOOKS like. Because of the emphasis on presentation rather than game-play, it creates a rather underwhelming gaming experience. 

P.S. -just have to get off my chest. . . .  WHY IS JONNU SMITH THE COVER THUMBNAIL COVER? I know its Josh Allen on the xbox cover at least, but on steam its Jonnu Smith. That's like going from a Taylor Swift stadium tour to Kelly Clarkson in a casino room.

With all the money they have, I cant believe how far this series has fallen backwards.  I am one of the minority here as I could care less about online features or ultimate team.  I just play franchise, and it is pathetic.  Gameplay is unrealistic as all heck, if you like just arcadey gameplay like 400 yards passing or rushing in a quarter like Blitz then this is it, but if you want a simulation its not.  You can try to tweak sliders ans waste your time just like the old days to make the game feel better (now you can only do it outside of the game).  
I will add a positive and thank you for finally adding in injuries in games and one aspect of sports and how you deal with these to gameplan.  Im sure the argument is who wants to play with bench players, but to me thats where the light shines.  Then these players make a name for themselves.  Penalties are still nowhere to be seen, thats all NFL is now are penalties and crying about how you got tackled or defended.  Amazing how you will go eight games (full length quarters) before a flag is even thrown with penalties set to max.  
Welp, I tried and hoped the next gen play would be something different, its not and even more pathetic than one would expect after not really playing madden for four+ years.  The last Madden I pick up for another 4-6 years.  The UI is so clunky now, and just amazing how they have taken features and menus out of the game and have literally upgraded nothing but some player and field models and add in some nonsense rpg stuff.  Just silly what they have turned this into.

I’ve been a die-hard NFL fan my whole life, and the lamentable state of my once beloved Madden is truly distressing. However, the only thing more disgraceful than EA’s treatment of this series is putting an overrated fraud like J*sh A*len on the cover. J*sh is a chubby, pencil-mustache-wearing, physically repulsive crybaby who is persistently overrated by a sycophantic media. Despite having never even reached a Super Bowl, they treat him like he’s John Elway reborn. The collective delusion would be hilarious if J*sh himself wasn’t so revolting as a player and a human being. In reality, the pest is a turnover machine with a massive ego, and his most noteworthy accomplishment is getting wrecked by Patrick Mahomes in the comically hilarious final 13 seconds of the 2021 AFC divisional round game. Seeing him so thoroughly humiliated on the national stage was delightful, and the subsequent complaining about the supposed unfairness of the overtime rules was the cherry on top of the schadenfreude sundae. If I must suffer his existence, then I will take solace in the many years of him getting slapped around by Mahomes/Burrow/Lawrence/Jackson until such time as he mercifully retires an overrated, pencil-mustache-wearing, ringless crybaby who was never once in danger of accomplishing anything of significance. Those four are superior players with more impressive resumes who have earned the adoration of their fans, unlike J*sh. He’s best known for flopping and complaining to the refs when things don’t go exactly as he wants.

In conclusion, don’t buy these terrible games. If you want a quality football video game experience, play some of the PS2-era Madden games or NFL Street, but more importantly, don’t put your faith in J*sh. He hasn’t earned a single ounce of the love poured upon him daily by the media, and he will only fail you. B*lls fans, I wish I could say I was sorry. This was the time for your laughable excuse of a franchise to shine; the Patriots were fading, and you didn’t ask to have this dunce drafted to your team, but you helped prop him up. I once mused that I would rather see the Eagles and Cowboys split the next 10 Super Bowls than the B*lls make a single appearance, but I never have to worry about that; they’ll never achieve anything. When your hopes for Lombardi wilt away like J*sh’s ego after another bone-headed interception, know that I take great pleasure in your misery.

its consuming in the worst of ways. specifically with mut. it shows flashes of being fun but you're mixed around playing games against pay to win teams. so you grind to get better cards, but in the end pay to win always wins. terrible company. terrible product for consumers. you dont get what you pay for. if you want to go no money spent you will ultimately always be the underdog. the games you get into are so flukey, its blows my mind how completely frustrating this game can make me. the season pass is structured such that you have to complete daylies and weeklys just to keep up but if you fall behind, by the time you get competitive cards, they're useless within a week. so the grind ends up being for nothing. in the end, this game is a fantastically beautiful piece of junk. it shows flashes of fun, but ultimately doesnt leave you feeling satisfied. only frustrated that the game robs you of your time with the way the game directs the entire experience to allow for flukiness. its such an unbelievably broken game. always is, always will be. I'm a football nerd and love playing madden. Honestly I'd switch off EA so quick if someone else had rights to NFL or NCAA. 

The lag when you play in an offline mode is crazy. Before every big play or big throw there's a massive lag spike and players almost "reset". Makes the game look and play like garbage. Some of the new passing mechanics just flat out don't work and it doesn't matter where your crosshair is on the throw. They said "We revamped the D-backs!" but just playing an AI wide-out is impossible because it all depends on the random animations you get from the EA engine. You can have perfect coverage and it just doesn't matter. Running the football on both sides is crazy too. Again, every tackle has some bullshit animation and once you're in it you can't be knocked out. So a RB running the ball up the middle could get hit at the line of scrimmage then hit by 4 more defensive players but since he's locked in an animation it just doesn't matter. The ball carrier will just stumble forward for another 6 yards. 


The game is ugly, Un-playable in offline modes and even more un-playable in online modes. The only highlight is the Franchise mode that's been exactly the same for the last 6 years. The features become annoying and you just end up turning off any new content and the only reason i still play it is to build and draft random teams. I mean...they completely gave up on the "be a superstar" mode. They just added a combine mini game the pretty much the same thing as the 2k gym practice and said "fuck it, lets made millions". 

its such a lazy game franchise and I hate myself for buying and playing every new game. Youre so lucky to have a contract with the NFL because if it was any other gaming industry i would never play another EA madden game again. I'm gonna go back to simming entire seasons and building rosters because it's really the only feature that works most the time and is worth playing. 

Fuck you EA.

I only ever play Madden on PC so this is my first time playing with all the exclusive current gen features. This game is amazing so far. Easily the best Madden I have ever played. The playbook, changing directions on the run, the sense of QB speed, the challenge of passing the ball with so much control. I look forward to practicing my passing skills more. There's also home field advantage back after all these years! You can even listen to the entire Eagles fight song! There's also more penalties such as illegal man down field!

Cons:
- No up-to-date rosters. You have to find custom community rosters to get a more accurate roster.
- The music is still horrible rap music, all 42 songs
- QB sneak looks nothing like it does in real life. It's pretty awful
- A little buggy. You find odd things such as jersey numbers change colors, crashes
- Sometimes when I start a game in franchise mode the game never loads and I have to restart the whole game
- Starting thiss game is very slow because it has to load the EA client everytime
An absolutely atrocious PC port.

3/10 $60.00 roster update that somehow has regressed in the gameplay and a lot of the same bugs from the past two years have not been fixed. I have been playing Madden since it was on Nintendo 64 and I feel like a complete sucker every year. I enjoy playing franchise mode, simulating seasons, creating draft classes, and trying to create a dynasty. I am just going to name a few little bugs and glitches I have noticed.
1. Franchise stats, for some reason, some players like Nick Bosa do not show up in the NFL defensive statistics
2. Draft class edits, the editor is slow and laggy, and doesn't even save any of the equipment edits you make, causing all of the draft classes to be super generic.
3. Player numbers randomly change for a lot of the drafted players to number 9, and there will be like 4 players with the same number. 
4. The game just lags randomly midplay when passing or kicking field goals. Super frustrating
5. As a PC user, its nice to have access to the next gen systems, but why do they lag the game so much? 
6. Why can't they bring old systems back like pro bowl voting and maybe give a seasonal reward for best tight end! If I make the super bowl, my players should still be pro bowlers and alternates should be announced
7. All storylines get super plain after the first completed season. As a 49er fan, its pretty much always just Trent Williams retiring in the offseason and then that is it. There are way less press conferences and such in following seasons

It is a real shame they have no competition and take advantage of us consumers by not even updating or fixing the game. They have a monopoly, and EA is absolutely exploiting us by making bare minimal changes to the same product and repackaging and selling it like a new product. All they care about is micro transactions.

I have to say the game play has gotten some improvement, but I can also say that the game play is at most times disgraceful.  I came to the conclusion that 99% of the people who work on these games have never watched a game of football .  Why you might ask, well jump balls in this game are nonexistent because the db's always knock the ball away where in real life they are usually 50/50 but in this game its more like 90\10 for the db's, the ai pass coverage is as bad as its ever been because watching the safeties and corners play as if they never should've made it past high school is pretty frustrating, and overall the game is just another spit in the face to all the fans who have been playing these games there whole lives.  After years of being on the frostbite engine you would expect a lot of fixes to be made but no, they "fix" issues by creating other problems.  If I was John Madden I would be upset if I knew a company was using my name for something as embarrassing as this game.  The only positive and the reason I have so many hours is because of the franchise mode which is a lot of fun.  Don't buy this game if you only play games but if you like franchise mode and simulating I would reccomend this game for you.  If they could maybe spend time on one game and make it look like an actual football game then EA would have an absoulte hit.  Until that happens I won't be giving madden another shot.  Feels like I'm watching 2nd grade football at times.

Ill keep it simple, in the 53 minutes I played, I spent more time trying to get the game to work than I did actually on field making plays. I spent my time in the options, trying to figure out why the game was running choppy and laggy, I changed graphics settings despite having a 3080, I googled forums and turned to reccomended settings, and I capped my game at 120fps on  a monitor and pc that can handle higher, just so the game could be more stable. Whilst these things did make the game better, I still felt like there was such a delay between picking plays and them happening, and just all around these little things that I much preffered the other games for. I've had Madden 22 for a couple years now and it seems like I will be keeping it another year until EA optimise their game, I was excited for next-gen on PC and after FIFA made the jump I thought it was a solid effort, but this is nowhere near that level of optimisation. EA Do better, and Consumers do not buy untill reviews or videos confirm the game runs better.

Then there is also the price increase.. seems ea never really learned. I will also add wth is going on with this game? I am playing through my second season and outta nowhere my player truned black? Is this the reverse Michael Jackson dlc?

Likes:
Updated rosters, with new rookies. It's always fun.
The new Superstar game mode, that has its many fun things, you get to be a rookie going through the combine and ultimately getting drafted, to whatever team you like, or leave it up to your draft stock to decide.
Field sense, as a person who doesn't have a Next Gen Console, I was let down by Madden 23 choice not to include it for PC users. But now that it is in the PC version of Madden 24, it is a big relief. And is a fun addition to the game.

Dislikes:
Players will get stuck on opponents and not know what to do, just run in place and screw up routes.
Opponent players have a crazy jump and reaction time, and pick your QB's throw in the most unrealistic moments ever.
It is poorly optimized, and eats a lot of your CPU, and the game goes into a slow-motion state, which screws up plays and reads.

All in all, the game needs some optimization updates for the game to run more fluid.
The AI needs some tweaks, so we don't get obvious PI's because the AI get stuck in each other, and for the crazy INT catches that happen.

Even with all these things to consider, it's a very fun game.
But 69,99? Come on... No way inflation has this big of an impact on the video game industry. Bring back the 59,99 please

Haven't played madden since... 2013(?) I think; because of how little content the developer provided for the fun game modes like franchise and superstar and how STUPIDLY hard they push their micro-transaction crap. Saw a trailer for this game and its "new and improved superstar mode" and was hopeful that they would have actually improved (stupid I know.) 

EA has NOT improved... superstar mode is generic and crappy, your choices in the locker room and/or during events do NOT matter at all except for a very lack-luster stat progression mechanic. Your player character is flat and lacks any charisma and most importantly, has VERY FEW dialog options AND those options are all delivered in this same, boring, flat, "yo dog I'm so cool because I talk like this bro" crap way of speaking. 

THE GOOD
-I actually do like the tackling... much improved from last I played. That is all I can say good about it. 

THE BAD
-PC control scheme is ******* STUPID. Give us the ability to do our own key binding!!! ITS NOT HARD! Just about semi-decent game dev gives their players the ability to do their own keybinding on PC. I know EA and the Madden devs in particular are now where near being semi-decent game devs but it would be nice to see them try. 
-Camera for superstar mode is STUPID. 
-Receivers drop the ball ENTIRELY too much for NO reason. Drop pass on big hit? Sure I'm for that. Drop the ball on EVERY gentle, from behind grab? Yes... yes they do that too. 
-Receivers also quite often drop the ball with NO interference... (my receivers might just happen to have CRAP catching skills so grain of salt there.)
-AI pathing is a MESS. My receiver will be running towards an open spot on the field... I hit him with a bullet. Unfortunately right as I throw the receiver will run into a defender who is chasing another receiver... the defender will then proceed to either dead stop or DRAG MY RECEIVER BACKWARDS as the ball is on the way... not only is this STUPID design... the game doesn't even have the decency to call pass interference or illegal touching or whatever for the defender literally throwing around a receiver who is running a route well down field. 
-REALLY REALLY HATE EA's non-stop advertising of their stupid "give us money to receiver "super-ultra-legendary player card (insert player here)" that they CONSTANTLY redirect you to when returning to the menu. 
-REALLY REALLY HATE how poorly optimized the menu and UI is for this game. Frame drops, slow loading, stutters etc... though the actual game runs smooth on my PC.
shitty game. shitty company.
Nope shit game. Shit optimization. Bugs everywhere. MUT forced on you. EA garbage. Minor "upgrades"

Speaking strictly on PC, Madden 24 is an improvement over 23. The addition of next gen features feel so much better over the old gen and you have a LOT more control over your characters. 

Added tackle animations make it feel alive again over old gen and the presentation I think is superior.

This is after one game and some practice, but I recommend this game to PC players simply for the new gen mechanics. 

People are rightfully complaining over things that should not exist in this product, and it is certainly glitchy, but accounting for the fact that this is your only choice, it is a lot more fun than 23.

Introduction:
Madden 24, the latest installment of the renowned Madden NFL video game series, has left many fans feeling underwhelmed and dissatisfied. While the franchise has had a long-standing reputation for delivering innovative and immersive football gaming experiences, Madden 24 falls short in multiple aspects. This essay aims to explore the reasons why Madden 24 fails to meet the expectations of its ardent fanbase.

Lack of Significant Improvements:
One of the primary issues with Madden 24 is the lack of significant improvements compared to its predecessors. While fans eagerly anticipate each new installment, hoping for groundbreaking features that enhance their gaming experience, Madden 24 fails to deliver in this regard. The developers seem to have merely focused on superficial changes, such as updated player rosters and improved graphics, rather than addressing the core gameplay elements that need attention.

Repetitive Gameplay Mechanics:
Another notable drawback of Madden 24 is the repetitive nature of its gameplay mechanics. It appears that the developers either failed to introduce fresh ideas or were unable to successfully implement them. As a result, players are left with a sense of monotony as they find themselves performing the same plays, executing identical strategies, and encountering few challenges in their gameplay journey. This lack of variety and innovation ultimately fails to engage and captivate fans, leaving them feeling disinterested and frustrated.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) Flaws:
Furthermore, Madden 24 proves to be a disappointment due to significant flaws in its AI system. While realistic AI plays a crucial role in maintaining the immersive nature of sports video games, Madden 24 struggles to offer a competent and believable AI experience. Players frequently witness unrealistic behaviors from both their teammates and opponents, ranging from nonsensical decision-making to inconsistency in their performance. These AI flaws profoundly impact the overall authenticity and enjoyment of the game, leading to considerable disappointment among fans.

Neglected User Feedback:
A crucial aspect contributing to the dissatisfaction surrounding Madden 24 is the apparent negligence of user feedback. Developers typically rely on input from the community to identify areas of improvement and address glaring issues in subsequent releases. However, it appears that the developers of Madden 24 have overlooked or disregarded many valuable suggestions articulated by the players. This failure to actively listen and incorporate user feedback has resulted in a game that disregards the desires and needs of its dedicated fanbase, further cementing Madden 24 as a lackluster addition to the franchise.

Conclusion:
Madden 24, sadly, fails to live up to the standards set by its predecessors and ultimately disappoints fans. The lack of significant improvements, repetitive gameplay mechanics, flawed AI, and the overlooked user feedback collectively contribute to the overall poor reception of this game. As fans continue to seek authentic and innovative experiences in their football gaming endeavors, Madden 24's shortcomings highlight the need for the franchise to refocus its efforts on delivering engaging, immersive, and intelligently designed gaming experiences that satisfy the expectations of its loyal fanbase.

So this is my first ever Madden Game. I sat on not buying it for a while due to people poorly reviewing it and the hefty price of $70. Eventually I sucked it up and bought it as I wanted to try it out and my friend was enjoying it. I still have not been able to try everything it offers as I have mostly stayed to Ultimate Team and Franchise anyways. 

I do not have the best rig and so it was very laggy at first when I was put into stadiums to where I would get 5-10fps and 3 fps at the worst. Although it was a mix of just the game being poorly optimized it seemed because as soon as I broke into the game more and season two came out, I saw a boost in my FPS boost to upwards of 20 and 30, but an upgrade to my pc would probably be needed to make it overall better but that is besides the point.

Some specs for people who care

Computer is on Windows 10 Pro
AMD Ryzen 5 3600 6-Core Processor
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 (4gb VRAM)
64-bit operating system/x64-based processor
16gb of Ram

For Ultimate Team, I know EA is known for being cash hungry when it comes to the shop and I can obviously see that with the offers they have, enticing you to buy them. Does that mean you can't have a good team if you don't buy those packs? Absolutely not. I have been able to build a pretty good team without spending a dime on the special currency. Yes it requires you to grind out challenges and the pass but for me, that makes it fun to an extent. I will admit I am a noob and I don't really enjoy playing head 2 head as I am always outskilled and out framed but I find ways to enjoy ultimate team nevertheless. There are some things I wish the game taught me earlier but I have been able to work around it.

Franchise is the mode I knew to an extent already and I got what I expected. It obviously takes time to get decent at but I have had a decent amount fun for the hours I have played on it,

Do I recommend this for computers on the lower/older end? It would depend your specs and what not. I have old ass  and low vram on it so that contributes to the lag but as I mentioned earlier I have worked around it and it has been made better. I can not recommend waiting for a price dip and if it's worth changing from 23 to 24 because as I said, this is my first ever madden game. 

Although to end this off, I do overall enjoy the game contrary to some of the reviews. Is the game still buggy and needs fixes. Hell yes it does, but it's not to the point where it doesn't make me want to play it, and from what it seems EA has helped fix some of the bugs already. This review will obviously be subject to change but as of now this is my opinion on it.

It's pretty much the normal Madden roster update.  I hadn't played Madden in a number of years and wanted to pick this one up, remembering the fun I used to have playing franchise and head to head.  While it doesn't seem as though there's been much (if any) development in those areas, I guess I can say that it feels much the same as I recall.  So, if you enjoy playing an NFL game, this is decently good for that.  Unfortunately, it's currently your only option and therefore, lacks improvement.  Monopolies are never good.  For me, this satisfied my desire to play an NFL-based game.

Also, after reading others' reviews, I can say that I don't experience many of the same gripes they do.  My game isn't nearly as laggy as people make it out to be, and the AI players aren't nearly as bad as I recall them being in earlier versions of the game.  Sure the menus are slightly sluggish, but not nearly as bad ass people made them out to be in my opinion.

Disclaimer: I've still yet to play an online head to head game against anyone except friends so far, so I can't speak to that.

Madden NFL 24 Superstar Mode Review: A Missed Opportunity in Football's Virtual Spotlight

Madden NFL 24's Superstar mode makes a return, but falls short of expectations, leaving fans yearning for more from this cherished feature.

Pros:

Reintroduction of Superstar Mode:
It's a positive move to bring back Superstar mode, catering to fans who enjoyed it in previous iterations. The familiarity is a welcome sight for long-time enthusiasts of the franchise.

Cons:

Lackluster Storyline:
The mode disappoints in terms of narrative depth and meaningful choice dialogs, resulting in a less engaging experience. The potential for a compelling story arc is left largely untapped.

Repetitiveness Takes Its Toll:
Repetitive elements within the mode diminish its enjoyability, making it feel like a chore rather than an engaging experience. Players find themselves in a loop, craving more variety and unpredictability.

Stagnant Commentary:
The recycled announcer lines contribute to a sense of staleness, highlighting a need for more dynamic and varied commentary. A fresh perspective on commentary would greatly enhance immersion.

Untapped Potential:
Madden NFL 24's Superstar mode could benefit from a more ambitious approach, akin to NBA 2K's open-world concept, offering greater player interaction and customization options. A deeper level of engagement and personalization is sorely missed.

Need for Innovation:
There's a call for a fresh perspective in the development team to infuse new life into this mode, as the current iteration lacks the spark needed to captivate players. Innovative ideas and execution are needed to breathe vitality into this once-vibrant mode.

Conclusion:
Madden NFL 24's Superstar mode feels like a missed opportunity in football's virtual spotlight. While it's positive that the mode has returned, the lackluster storyline, repetitiveness, and stagnant commentary leave much to be desired. There's a clear need for more innovation and ambition in the development process to elevate this mode to its full potential and reignite the excitement it once generated among players.

When I first played the game, I thought the game was broken. I was getting all kinds of lag and stuttering issues and even worse, atrocious input lag. I totally regretted buying the game. 

But the game isn't broken. The problem was my old PC I was trying to run the game on that was the problem. 

I just upgraded my motherboard and CPU to a ryzen 5 5600X 3D with 16 gb of ram and decided to fire up Madden once again and give the gane another shot.

The game runs silky smooth now with absolutely no lag or that slow-mo gameplay I was getting before. 

I'm now loving the game! It's awesome. The gameplay on the field is fast now! and very responsive. The in game menues no longer have lag too.

I hadn't purchased a Madden game since Madden 2007. And I wasn't going to buy it on PC until EA implemented all the features that are on console. So that's the only reason why I bought Madden this year.

If you're having trouble running the game maybe the time has come to upgrade your system. My system isn't the greatest. My GPU is an XFX RX6600. But it was the CPU upgrade that has made the difference.

Anyway, the game looks great and is a whole lot of fun for me now. I recommend it 8/10

This is based purely on Superstar mode:
It's Madden, if you have played Madden you know what to expect. Can be a lot of fun and can also feel super cheap. Announcers get cut off mid sentence on occasion after drives and the commentary has moments where it makes no sense. I played as the Bucs and you would hear the announcers say that the "Bucs coming off a win over Tampa Bay last week". It pulls you out of it. The first season has the analysts talking about you in a general way and there is some pretty good production value. As always the first season is the most flashy then the following ones are just football. Nothing wrong with that at all. Where the game loses me is when I faced the Bears with Justin Herbert, the Falcons with Dak Prescott, the Saints with Joe Burrow, the Panthers with Derek Carr. The following season I ended up with Nick Bosa on my defense, DHop and McCaffery on the offense and the NFL QB situation was even more random.

After 4 seasons I was offered a 1 year contract, which I thought was strange because they could have just used the 5th year options but I accepted. Went through that season and I was offered a 2 year... Really? So at this point I decided to see what would happen if I declined the contract just to see what teams I could go to. (I had won 5 straight Superbowls at this point as QB and had broken the season passing and passing TD records). I had only 1 team offer me a contract, I accepted. The screen flashed a couple times and apparently I was never added to the roster because it kept having a blank window when I advanced the week and the game forced me to retire after 5 seasons.

This mode, while functional, feels broken, the team you are on never makes you a team captain and only gives you 1 to 2 year contracts at a time. If this is intended then there should be an actual option to increase the number of years you want to play for the team. If they don't want that added work fix the team bidding option or put negotiations during the season like in Franchise mode. The lack of contract negotiations for a mode like this is pretty lacking.

Overall... it is what it is. I would suggest playing franchise with a player you make yourself. it feels much better than this mode.

This game is unplayable. An embarrassment for EA, making a game 70 dollars just to make it worse than every madden to ever be made. 
     The actual gameplay is terrible. Passing is terrible, and throws are about 20 less mph than real life. If you bullet pass it into an area withing 10 feet of a defender it will get intercepted. Blocking is worse than its ever been. Blockers will miss assignments right in front of them simply because the animation doesnt happen. Speaking of animations, nothing will go right with a 100% animation based game. Countless in game bugs, like players kicking the football 50 yards, or failing to pick up a ball on the ground 10 times. Dbs in this game are also worse than ever before. In the NFL, the best of the best completion percentages are just under 80 percent, which is incredible. Quarterbacks will average 80 percent against you in this. Drag routes are uncoverable in man, along with slants zigs C routes, which are all extremely basic routes even college Dbs can cover. Jump balls always seem to go to the defender unless its you defending. Tackling is impossible, when playing on all madden you have about a 15 percent chance of an open field tackle, no matter who the players, even when secure tackling. Movement behind the line of scrimmage is terrible, you cant do anything but run, despite numerous qbs being known for maneuvering around the pocket with ease. If a defender is coming to sack you the only thing you can do is run away or throw it. Throwing the ball away is stupid, the qb usually has about 10 brain cells when trying to do it. fumbling is terrible, despite it happening almost every game, regular tackles never seem to force fumbles ever. throwing is stupid, and overly complex. players look like woody  when they are running, and speed is nothing like the real nfl. 
   Now, outside of the actual gameplay, there is unsuprisingly numerous issues. First, overalls are always stupid, but thats just a madden norm now. Keeping old players like Chandler Jones and Eric Kendricks high overalls with abilities despite underperformance. The servers are down just about once a day it seems. But my main issue that i am extremley upset about is superstar mode. First of all, it took me about 20 hours to actually get into the mode, because when I click start career it sticks me into a blue loading screen, continues to play music, but never loads despite how long you wait. This happens about 90-100% of the time. Then, sometimes when you are trying to reenter your current career, it just keeps bringing  you out of it. This alone makes superstar career basically unplayable. But I am not finished. I made a running back career and got put on the Bengals. The Bengals have an excellent qb incase you dont know. Well I got through about 4 games and Joe Burrow already threw 16 interceptions. I dont know why the AI does this, but it makes the actual gameplay  extremely frustrating. I also made a qb career, and for some reason it is extremely laggy when i actually play the qb games, and i basically never lag outside of that mode. Another slightly but less important thing is that there is no setting to turn off manual play calling in career mode. I feel it would make the whole you are a player not the whole team thing more real, but that isnt that important. Another issue is just the bugs in general. I wont dive deep into this but there are numerous, numerous bugs. 
   In conclusion, for a 70 dollar game, the most expensive its ever been, to make an unplayable game is inexcusable, and Madden needs to be boycotted. DO  NOT BUY THIS GAME DO NOT BUY IT UNTIL THAT MAKE IT PLAYABLE( NEW ENGINE, NO ANIMATIONS, NO BUGS, NOT PAY TO WIN, ACTUAL FUN MECHANICS, REALISTIC). this game gives me low expectations for the new college football game they are making on the same engine.

I've purchased every single madden since Madden 12 when I was in middle school, and this is the first time I have outright regretted the purchase. This is the first year that the PC port of Madden is matched to the current gen versions of the game, so I was super stoked for this. Unfortunately I hyped myself into buying the deluxe edition to play it three days early and coughed up the $90 just to end up with a stuttery/jittery mess. Obviously with the new technology Madden devs have been showcasing leading up to this, it takes some time to adjust to the new gameplay and learn the details of the mechanics, but unfortunately it's next to impossible when the game consistently dips to less than 15 FPS before and during every single play, along with the menu screens taking an obnoxiously long time to load. I run RDR 2 and Baldurs Gate 3 on max settings flawlessly, but who would have thought that the PC port of Madden 24 on low settings would perform this way. Very disappointed.

SPECS: GTX 2060 Super, Ryzen 7 3700x, 32 GBs RAM

TL,DR; hold off to see if they patch it. Game is next to unplayable in it's current state

UPDATE 9/30 - Still not fixed. I'd refund if I still could

It's a money sink pretending to be a NFL simulator. Its clear that EA cares more about pushing you to buy in game micro transactions than improving the game.

Pros:
- Brought next gen to PC (only reason I bought it)
- Run blocking is improved
- The preorder bonuses came with a minimum $50 USD worth of in game currency for M.U.T.

Cons:
- They announced cross-play but didn't bring it to Franchise mode
- Server bugs out frequently and doesn't give you card packs you earned for M.U.T.
- Card packs to improve your team in M.U.T. can cost hundreds of dollars with minimal return on your investment (its literal gambling)
- Some cards that you spend real money on can't be 'quicksold' back into in-game currency
- Game stutters horribly on the best video cards available
- Menu UI is absolutely lethargic
- Gameplay is riddled with bugs
- There are three different systems to pass the ball and none of them 'feel' quite right
- No in-game UI for managing tournaments. You literally queue up through a third party app and then have to manually add your opponent as a friend and play them that way. An honor system follows to record the winner on the third-party website (are you kidding me?)
- Zero customer support. I've opened many help tickets to try and get my card packs reimbursed and all they do is 'punt' the ticket around. They asked me to open a forum post to 'see if anyone else' has this issue without even bothering to look at the forum post that has been sitting there.

Welp another year, another $70. I will give credit where credit is due. This game does improve on some issues me and my friends were having specifically with Franchise mode, and the PC version of the game. I do however believe this needs to be just the beginning. They need to continue to work and improve player models, animations, and introduce an actual physics based engine that can replicate actual football movements. They also need to increase community cross-play. Allowing Franchise players to FINALLY be able to play with their friends on other systems. I would've much preferred that over a freaking cross-play for basic ass online play and MUT. EA didn't completely shit the bed, but they also didn't hit a home run either. I give this game an easy 6/10, slightly above average for what we usually come to expect with EA, and a 3/10 for what we would usually expect from a AAA game developer.

[h1]The game actually got [u]better[/u][/h1]

[b]Context / back story[/b]

So, I live in the Netherlands (Europe?) where soccer is basically the national sports; (NFL) football is non-existant. Me being a bit of a geek and all I never really cared about sports, [i]until[/i] Steam pointed me at "Madden '22". Still remembering my football curiosity courtesy of Al "4 touchdowns in a single game" Bundy from the Married with Children sitcom I decided to grab '22.

That changed [u]everything[/u] for me. Not only did I really enjoy playing the game of Madden '22 itself, I [i]also[/i] developed a [b]serious[/b] appreciation / love for the sports of NFL football itself. An NFL gamepass subscription soon followed (renewed this season!) and I can honestly say that Superbowl LVII was a [b]major[/b] highlight for both my girlfriend and myself (I managed to drag her into this big time!).

Why all the backstory you ask? Because I care about honest reviews, and I want to make sure that you (yes, [i]you[/i] random reader!) know where my review is coming from: driven by a passion for NFL football.

[b]An improved Madden![/b]

Some people will tell you that if you buy a new Madden game you're basically buying into a roster update. And honestly? They're not completely wrong perse [i]but[/i].. I also wonder if those critics realize the impact such a roster update has on the game? In Madden '23 my favorite team of the Panthers were ranked at 81. Now we're down to 80.

So here's a thing that stood out for me: while the Panthers are off to a bad start so far (= time of writing) their [i]defense[/i] is close to unstoppable. Within context...  and somehow that seriously manifests itself within this version of Madden as well. Look... if I (as a rookie) can stop the 49'ers offense even though I actually dislike playing defense? On exhibition with a simulation game style?

There's much [b]more[/b] involved with "a mere roster update" than just a bunch of new names you know...

[h1]Training camp & new passing mechanics![/h1]

How do you "step up" from a game like Madden '23 I wondered... a game that paid homage to one of the greatest names within the sports: John Madden himsef? Well, IMO EA managed to do just that: the game opens with a famous quote from Mr. Madden and then we're down to business! The first thing that stood out for me was the new red/purple colour scheme (not bad IMO) but also... the longer loading times. Ugh! Fortunately it seems that 'caching' is a thing and after having played more games those loading times did get somewhat better for me. Still.. what's up with all that?

When you get in the main menu you'll see many familiar names from the past... franchise, ultimate team, quick play and then we have [i]training camp[/i]? Yah, this isn't just the help section anymore: while you can (and should!) play through the "skill drills" (as I like to call it) there's more than just learning how to play the game..  As before "team practice" allows you to try out every possible situation within a game to see how you can get the best results. If you know how to play Madden but want to get better? You need to spend some time here...

But second.. "Mini games"! Yah, it looks silly at first glimpse and no: you don't earn any useful rewards like with the practices (these can get you rewards which you can use in UT?). [i]...or do you?[/i] Seriously: try looking at the bigger picture here, this isn't just about running around and earning medals: if you pay attention to what you're doing you're bound to use these experiences to get better in your regular games also!  IMO these mini games are a great way to practice very specific skills in very specific situations.

[b]New passing mechanic![/b]

I love this one!  EA has been touting their "field sense" ever since '23 and what did us PC players get? ZIP! Not anymore: there's a new passing mechanic and it is [u]good[/u]! Takes getting used to, can be tricky to master (I play with my trusty Steam controller btw) but DARN is this good => They added a skill based 'mini game' (don't worry: player stats are still held into account as well), and this basically means that you get better and more direct control over the way you pass a ball to another player.

There are 3 options:
[list]
[*] Placement & accuracy => Not only do you need to control the strength and way of passing: you [i]also[/i] get control over where around the receiver you want to pass the ball. If he's covered and you think he may break out on his left... why not pass the ball just over him around his left side?  Very hard to master, but very rewarding too.
[*] Placement + power => This doesn't give you any contol over where you want to try and make the ball land, but you do get to control the type of passing, and the power you put behind it. This is what I like to play with and it can still make a difference: a high lob on full power is still way different than a soft straight ball....
[*] Classic mode => Don't like all this fancy pancy stuff? No worries: this keeps things the way they were back in '23.
[/list]

[h1]The commentators are even more into the game than before![/h1]

I know not everyone appreciates this part as much as I do but [i]darn[/i] are they good! For me this is yet another reason why you may enjoy a "current" Madden game to back the current NFL season... it's but a detail for sure but I love how much factual knowledge these guys have and throw at us during a game. Take for example my favorite team of the Panthers? These guys know all too well about our new coach and rookie quarterback, and they're not only eager to share... I think some of their comments make darn good sense from a realistic perspective as well!  Picture me surprised to hear they mentioning how our (= Panthers) defense is sometimes better than the offense?!

Sometimes I just let the computer play itself while I sit back and enjoy the match [u]and[/u] the commentating.

However, that also brings us to...

[h1]This game is far from perfect though![/h1]

Readers beware... there are issues. I already mentioned the loading times, another issue being that this game is obviously in more demand of resources that its predecessor. Now, there is a good explanation for that I think... you no longer see half your team making the exact same gesture in perfect choreography which is a good thing but still. It seems a bit odd if you check the basics stats on the store page (or so I think).

Another immediately noticeable issue: the NFL agenda. At the time of writing Madden '24 is already one week behind the official season which I think is plain out sloppy, especially if you consider that this is an "officially supported' game.

In addition I am also aware that many players suffer from rather extreme issues such as a full stall of the game, and even full crashes! While I do not experience these myself I really understand how frustrating this must be. See; "another" game I recently bought (unrelated to football) manages to stall and crash the very moment I press F12 to make a screenshot!

Still....

[b]In conclusion....[/b]

Maybe bias is in effect here, who knows, but I can honestly say that I'm having a great time with the new Madden '24. However, do keep in mind that I'm a very casual player first and foremost. I mostly play single player, I enjoy the atmosphere and general vibe and love to check stats and make screenshots.

As always in this series... If you're new to the Madden franchise then I think you should ignore all reviews, even mine, and just give it a try for yourselves. While I [b]don't[/b] recommend using Steam's refund policy to demo games I also don't think that any bad can come from it assuming you don't refund games all that often. In full honesty: 90 minutes should be more than enough to give you a good impression of what this game is all about... way within the safety margin of the 120 deadline.

But it still gets a 2 thumbs up from me!

Thanks for reading!

I will break it down easily. 5 Hours in game plus 20+ years of Madden Experience. 

Pros: 
Next Gen on PC is huge!
Superstar Mode is back for the first time in YEARS! (Kinda)
The movement is really nice.
The animations are a ton better imo. 
Cross Platform is awesome.
EA actually has a Anti Cheat vs like 2k....
Player customization is pretty sick once you figure it out. 
Mod support on PC is AWESOME ALREADY! 
EA really made an attempt at doing something new for once bigger than just 1 mode the whole game seems to be modernized and revolutionized. You have to give this game and EA credit for that for once this year. 
Hits actually make you jump out of your seat again like they did back in the day with the added ragdoll like physics. 

***BEST PART IMO*** ALL MADDEN ON SIMULATION STYLE IS ACTUALLY HARD! I HAVE NEVER BEEN 0-9 EVER IN MADDEN BECAUSE IT TENDS TO BE SUPER EASY TO WIN WITH A MOBILE QB THIS YEAR NOT SO MUCH AT LEAST IN THE BEGINNING OF YOUR CAREER!***

Cons: 
Still a ton of the same bugs. (One you see every game in career or superstar/franchise mode is the camera goes to a weird angle making you have to call a timeout or run the play to fix it, gets really annoying in big game situations.)
There really isn't a ton of other cons in my opinion besides the bugs the game is actually pretty fresh but I will update this if I find things I do not like. 
***Lineman do not block well at all.*** Even with the slider adjustments the lineman just do not do much for you as a QB in SUPERSTAR MODE AT LEAST***

Listen, is this anywhere near what a madden in 2023 should be? Absolutely not. Is it simultaneously the best madden in recent history? Unfortunately yes. Dozens of different bugs, terrible passing mechanics, horrendous receiving animations, 99 ovr receivers will lose every contested catch against any DB, even 67 ovr players. Defense is finally playable, albeit not great. Pass rush move "point" system is horrendous. Franchise is a tiny bit better. Graphics are good. Can absolutely be fun if you play it with the mindset that its an amazing indie game. Try to forget this is the product of a bajillion dollar company with sole rights to produce this sort of thing and you just might enjoy it...for a while. 

Recommendations for improvement: Add the ability to set the draft order in fantasy please. If 2k can do it, so can you EA. I believe in you. Remove pass rush point system, either add 1,000 animations for catching and tackling or remove them all together because the current 5 are bad, whatever was done to passing; revert all changes. Seriously...so bad. Running game is solid. Blocking is finally okay. Ball carrier moves are terrible and slow and nonathletic and bad. Defense is okay but desperately needs some sort of AI overhaul so that players don't just stand motionless in zones half the time. MRCA! Make Receivers Catch Again! (Just a pun. Not indicative of any political ideologies.)

Rating based on the 2 modes I play that are relevant to the majority of people who play Madden NFL by EA Tiburon.

Franchise Mode: 8/10
Madden Ultimate Team Mode: 1/10


Franchise Mode is good and a lot of fun, but after 1 month of the game releasing, MUT (Madden Ultimate Team Mode) added an option to pay real money to level up your Field Passes.
So, EA Tiburon basically took away any rewarding feeling of actually playing and building your MUT team. It is 99% pay to play now,  So I can't, just can not recommend this game if your a MUT fan that likes to grind out rewards from Challenges and Field Passes to  build your MUT team as a NMS (No Money Spent) Player..

If your part of the community that mostly plays franchise Mode Connected or Offline, its fun with lots of variety as a Coach/ Owner.


Sad Times for everyone who loves MUT football, Past and Present.
Fun Times for everyone on PC that enjoys Franchise Mode and Regular Head 2 Head.

The last iteration of Madden football I've played was Madden 12 back when it was still a decent game.  I've been playing Madden football since Madden 94 so I'm pretty old.  I've watched the Angry Joe reviews and read a lot of the negative reviews for the last few years of Copy and Paste Football.  STILL... I decided after weighing the pros and cons (and after a strong pint of Sierra Nevada Imperial Stout) that maybe, just maybe, it has gotten better and maybe things have changed and the people being salty about it are just spoiled.  So I bought it.

After taking forever to download, I loaded the game which allowed me to pick my team (Raiders) and adjust the QB throwing accuracy mechanisms.  Cool right?  Well, after I completed that pass from Jimmy G to Davante... it freezes.  It just froze.  OK, no problem, I'll just run task manager, shut it off and restart right?  Open the game again, attempt a practice mode, game freezes while on the load screen.  I try again, restart game, pick practice mode, loading screen, game freezes again.  WTF?!?

Other than my CPU being a bit old which hasn't affected my gaming experience with games like Red Dead Redemption 2, NBA 2k23, Cyberpunk 2077, The Witcher 3 etc..., I have all of the recommended specs on my computer.  Nvidia Geforce 1660, 32GB of RAM, well over 50GB of HD space, all the software requirements with DirectX and this game just freezes every time I try to play some NFL football.  

Fine, I'll lower the graphics requirements on the settings menu so I do that and IT STILL FREEZES!!! I updated my drivers on Geforce Experience, same freezing.  After an hour or so of this, I've had enough.  I'm not going to spend more time on this game trying to trial and error why it's freezing so before I'm ineligible to do so, I request a refund from Steam.  

The worst part about this game is I didn't even get to experience the flawed game mechanics, the copy and paste programming, the MUT cards and any of the other crap everyone hates about modern Madden Football because of constant freezing in the loading screen.  On the plus side, I now have over $70 in my Steam wallet that I can now spend on a good game or even multiple good games.

Madden 24 disappoints on multiple fronts. It lacks innovation, suffers from outdated graphics and animations, and has unresponsive controls. The game modes feel stagnant, and the presence of microtransactions is a letdown. As a long-time fan, I expected more from this installment. Here's hoping for a brighter future for the franchise.

I've played Madden for a Bit on PC, and these are some of the issues, I refuse to play MUT so this review is just for Franchise mode and on all-pro/all madden diff, simulation style play

The bad

-Cant change uniforms, will automatically reset to original Home or Away. So old uniforms or color rush or anything else you cannot do
-Massive lag spikes during games, I have a good PC build, should be able to easily run this game with how little Madden actually puts into it but there are multiple occasions where the game will slow down to a crawl during the game in the middle of plays
-Receivers still don't feel like they will play for jump balls, but that has always been an issue
-Recycled announcer commentary, and downgrades too with announcers talking about the team winning or losing a week ago, even though my team was on a bye week
-overall nothing really blew me away in game-play, with it just feeling like a new madden roster on the same old game engine
-the drafting process is still overly complicated and kind of useless, but that is my opinion some may like it

The good

-Celebrations are cool with the animations being alright
-Run game feels good, linemen don't feel like brain dead AI, but sometimes they will let a defensive player fly through for a free sack or TFL
-you can restructure contracts to free cap space, no customization into it as it is just done by the game but still a nice touch
-Mini games for players you try to upgrade with the weekly strategy practice, but the rewards are not really worth the time put in
-new stadiums or moving the team and changing the name is pretty easy and cool, with new locations and team names, but most are just the old ones we have seen before

Overall
-Not worth 70$, maybe in time if they fix some of the game-play issues and glitches I would say its worth more around 35-40$.

I wasn't going to write a review for this game because everything has basically already been said but I recently got so pissed off at this game so here we are...
I got the game shortly after it was released, it was a okay basic madden copy-paste of last year but they added the "next-gen" features they held from us master race last year. At first he game barely ran half the time and would take several PC restarts to even get the game to run. Another issue was that the superstar mode didn't work for the first two weeks of the games release, and I've come to learn that is was a issue on all platforms. They seem to have somewhat fixed these issues with me not having a problem with either of those anymore, but I digress, the reason I'm writing this review is because of the crashing. Even from the very start this game had crashing issues, not even just the application crashing, Madden 24 would freeze and crash my ENTIRE PC, meaning I would have to hard reset my PC my holding the power button. This is almost a guarantee thing after running the game for a hour or two. I have never had issues like this with ANY of my games, compared to this. Never. Then today, this game forcefully shutdown my computer, BLUE SCREENED it and rendered my computer useless because it would simply boot up my bios and when I would try to exit the bios, It would simply boot it back up. After several hours of fiddling with my PC I got it to boot up windows. I am seriously scared of opening this game and having to deal with that mess again.
I tell you all that just to say that this game is another blatant cash grab from EA while they still have the license, if you still want the game then I would recommend waiting a couple months until they fix all the bullshit that they released. Hell that's thinking positively, I mean if they do EVER fix these issues because it is known that EA turns a blind eye to the PC consumers.
For anyone who cares I have a Intel Core i9, GTX 3080 Ti, with 32 GB of ram, my system is well prepared for a mid ass game like this, and all I want to do is just play the damn game.

Listen, i'm in no way a fan of EA or the madden franchise.

BUT, as a PC player, this game isn't bad. (speaking ONLY of franchise mode, I refuse to play ULT Team or anything i need to pay to win)

is it different then it was last year on current gen consoles? idk, i never played it on them.

but it is better for PC players than it was last year

Pros - 
- Graphics are better, not amazing, but better
- Animations are better
- Blocking feels better
- Catching seems more realistic
- kickoffs are actually kinda fun with the better blocking
- Trade offers seem more realistic, no longer are you getting offered a 65 overall player for a 83 ovr 23 year old qb
- It's next gen on PC which SHOULD be something they added years ago but its nice it's finally here

Cons
- Soundtrack is once again, terrible. idk why they insist on the same mumble rap soundtrack every year.
- graphics aren't great, again not bad but not $70 worth.
- outside the on-field game, there is like NO change. it's just a very basic UI. nothing really changed


Overall- 

I genuinely am enjoying my time with this game, the animations are better, the game feels smoother, and anything i was annoyed with before seems to at least have had an attempt at fixing. it may not be perfect but it IS better and i'd say for >$50 it's worth it.
absolutely abhorrent. I'm not sure whats worse, the fact that it is still the same game since Ive been 13 years old or the fact that I willingly purchased this POS at a HIGHER PRICE THAN LAST YEAR

I've been telling myself that I'm done buying these games every year and some how end up buying them anyways with the hopes that they are fixed and fun again. I can confidently say this is the worse one I've ever played. The user interface is horrible everything is buggy and delayed, i could look past this if the game play was good. The game play is where it is really a joke. i have a 3080 graphics card and have tried no fps limit and locked fps at 120 and every option there is and the input delay when you play online is so bad it's damn near unplayable, if you are someone like me that's super competitive and grinds the ultimate team don't even bother wasting your time. Even though its "crossplay" auction block is trash and hardly any cards on it. On top of that it's horrible how bad this game is pay to win, every game you load into is probably gonna have the highest overall cards in the game and that's so "fair". Its pointless to because even if you do grind and get a good team don't expect to play good because of all the input delay. This is the worst when you are usering someone on defense or being the QB and cant get the ball out of your hand when you literately pressed the button 2 seconds ago. So if you still are gonna bite the bullet and get this horrible excuse of a game i would just be looking forward to having fun playing franchise cause that's about all its good for. The superstar mode is semi fun but just constantly repetitive. The superstar mode is what finally pushed me to my breaking point and writing this review. Go to try to play a new superstar and game wont load in every time. This is funny scenes  how it'll keep playing the stupid garbage music they have on every year but wont load my game. Hope this helps just on person, please take what i say into consideration. If you wanna spend 60$ or 100$ just go spend it on something else or another game instead. Take it from me, the dumb guy who's already wasted 200$ on this pathetic excuse of a game.

When I heard Madden 24 was going to be cross-platform, I was super excited. Over the last few years, the pc port just didn't have the player base to make online modes (like MUT) playable. After 62 hours of gameplay, I can thoroughly say this is no longer a problem. However, the EA mindset is a seriously problem. I grinded MUT for multiple weeks to learn the hard way that packs just ruin the gameplay. It was tolerable until this week when a bunch of 87 overalls realeased and the only consistent way to get them is to spend $50-100 jon packs. For a AAA title that comes in at a already high price ($60), I can not support such actions. Also, all modes except for MUT have no intention and completely a waste of time.

But Beware. This is for franchise and Super mode as a Quarterback. Madden 24 has not corrected a lot of things. 1. Be aware that the QB fumbles if he runs and gets tackled. It is too unrealistic for it happens more than it should. 2. The game will not kick a field goal when its a critical 4th down at the end of the game. If you want ensure a field goal choose it on the 3rd down. Also with Madden 24 some of the receivers do not run their full route at times and they are interfered with on the run and no penalty is ever called. So with all that said it appears the game cheats for the other team. So when that happens exit the game. Go to the main menu and delete the game in progress and start the game over. Most important is develop your own custom playbook. Find out what plays work for you.

It's bad enough that it's Windows only so they can put their rootkit on your system to decide if you're worthy to play their game. 


I jumped through their hoops anyways, and set up a separate boot just for Windows, just for Madden, because I love Madden that much. It didn't fucking work. I reinstalled Windows. Still didn't work. Downgraded to 10. Still didn't work. Installed EA Play from their website, then reinstalled Madden. Still didn't work. Used their anticheat installation tool to uninstall, reinstall, tried the repair. None of it worked. I spent literal hours (in addition to download times) just trying to get the thing to launch. I never got past the "select your passing controls" menu. It doesn't function.

I'd swear this game is 15 years ahead of my current specs the way the performance sucks, but nope, instead I'm facing major performance issues on a game that looks like it'd run very well on specs from 15 years ago. The fact they released this without ironing out blatant issues is beyond me, and charging $70 too!

Yet, I wait patiently for fixes because I do enjoy franchise.

Reviewing based on going from last gen last year to current gen this year. Passing feels great and doesn't feel scripted anymore. With skill based passing I can place the ball where I want. Running feels better as well. Game-play feels solid this year overall. 

Some presentation issues, but it looks better this year with the TD cameras and stats. Where is the Nex Gen Stats? That feature looked cool to me when I saw it on consoles and am disappointed it's not here.

Haven't tried Superstar mode yet, but will update if I do. 

Game-play feels so much better and I'm having fun with it. Blocking looks improved, catching, running, etc. I put 100s of hours in '23 and this feels like a drastic improvement game-play wise. Presentation needs cleaning up, and Franchise mode still needs constant additions to make it feel better.

Recommend solely for upgrade from last gen game-play to current gen.

Okay, I'll be honest. This is my first Madden game EVER. I have never played an American football game before in my life. Jumping into this, I was skeptical due to the bad reviews. But as someone who has never played old Madden games before, this game is amazing. The physics, graphics, animations – everything is very nicely done. The gameplay is also very enjoyable. I honestly cannot see what the bad reviews are for. Therefore, since I've never played the old Madden games, I really can't know. But for someone who's playing for the first time, this game is a WIN. Definitely recommend.

This is so much better than Madden 19, my last foray into the Madden PC market. No, it isn't perfect, but it's still really good for what it does offer. This is not your Madden from a decade ago where you can just spam long bombs, have endless pick 6's, punt and kick return TDs, and the animations feeling really scripted. This just feels so much better overall than what I was used to in the past. 

Graphics are really nice overall

Gameplay feels fluid

Running the ball is actually possible (and fun!) versus previous Maddens where I felt like really the only course of action was to throw the ball or scramble for big gains with someone like a Michael Vick every other play and just cheese it. The blocking is pretty good now as well!

I have a 13900k and a 4090 for reference and I'm running the game at 120 fps locked. Aside from a few cutscene hitches and audio not being present sometimes for certain aspects of the pre-game, etc, it's a pretty nice experience.

Anyway, I'm completely happy with my purchase. If you wanna find hate and whining, there are plenty of reviews like that here, but I have to be honest, when I look at all the hate on YouTube, I had to ask myself, "Am I playing the same game as these guys?" My experience has been far more positive than theirs. To hear some of these guys talk you would think Madden was completely broken and unplayable lol.

This game is currently unplayable for millions of people and EA does not care at all.

UPDATE: Steam wants to know if I'd like to update this review, and let me tell you I would absolutely love to. The update is that 2 weeks have passed since the game launched and I left this review, and absolutely nothing about the game has changed and EA still does not care at all. 

This game still doesn't even run for half the people who bought it on PC, and EA's only comments are that they want to fix menu lag and passing in ultimate team mode, because those are 2 things directly tied to how much more money they can milk out of players with microtransactions.

At this point, if you buy this game on PC, you are part of the problem and why EA gets away with such a disgrace of a product.

Honest Review - Positive Purchase.

I have always played Madden on console. This was my first time purchasing/playing on PC. With all of the negativity surrounding this game, I was very hesitant to purchase. However, I am very glad that I did some of my own research prior to purchasing. With ease, I was able to link my Steam account with EA Play and immediately booted up the game with no problems. I capped the FPS at 60 and made some other minor changes to the graphics settings. I have about three hours of gameplay in with zero input delay, lag or stuttering issues. I’m glad I made the purchase. Hope this helps someone else!

there are so many little things madden could add back to make it feel like you arent just watching your players play and feel like a actual coach/owner in franchise mode. (espn weekly review) (custom plays) (pregame coin toss). small but noticeable issues like if a player is injuried and you tell madden you want to sub them out rather than risking a injury they still come in the game. Also, I had 2 players get injuried in my superbowl and left the game and when we won the superbowl the players were out on the field celebrating because they are listed as the first stringers on the depth chart... same with the announcers in the game having the same 3 voicelines every year for every emotion that could happen during a play... game winning touchdown in the preseason? "and its caught for a touchdown!" game winning touchdown in the superbowl? "and its caught for a touchdown!" maybe get new announcers for the game so it feels fresh considering you have to listen to them in every game mode you play. maybe consider making AI qbs not be complete robots in the pocket. I played franchise mode games against justin fields, lamar jackson, and josh allen and whenever they didnt have a guy open they still wouldnt even consider running the ball.
