For years I was an every year, 1000s of hours, release day buyer for Madden. Madden 18 was so bad that I vowed to take a break for years to let them sort some shit out. Surely waiting 6 years would make M24 feel like an actual upgrade right? Nope, same old shit. For reference I am a franchise only player so IDGAF about MUT or anything else, my review is "offline" (it's actually forced online) franchise centric, considering this is supposed to be the official simulation experience of the NFL.

-Players feel sluggish, and just making them do what you want them to do is a struggle. Making these players do things they could do in real life is the whole point of a football game, but it still feels like running in quicksand. 

-Aggressive catch was useless in M18 and before, it's still useless. Same goes for possession WRs. Madden somewhere along the line decided that it should simply be impossible to complete a pass in traffic unless you're in MUT using Moss. An elite 95+ spec and CIT receiver 1 on 1 with a corner 6 inches shorter in real life is an auto throw and very likely a huge completion. In madden, it is either just dropped inexplicably, picked, or popped up in the air. There just isn't really an animation for catching a pass over a defender. It's utterly bizarre that this has gone unaddressed for a half a decade+. A very common type of receiver and play is simply not viable even 10% of the time in madden. I play with the Colts mostly, and Michael Pittman Jr. isn't Tyreek Hill, but he should be able to separate and make tough catches. But in madden there's simply no value in receivers who win via anything but speed and he isn't any fun to use. Make it make sense.

-these are NFL players, but sometimes it feels like I can't get them to do something I would be able to as a regular person because controls are so sluggish and unpolished. It isn't fun to control these guys, which is a pretty major part of a sports game.

-trench play still doesn't feel realistic. I have Quenton Nelson on my team but he doesn't feel powerful or smart at all.

-it's still very noticeable that the AI has very different rules for itself vs you, which is a terrible piece of game design. The beauty of the NFL is how coldly equal it is for everyone, and you don't get that from madden. Balls my players can reach they'll inexplicably short arm, while the CPU makes plays you know your players never would. 

-The commentators are still the worst in sports games. Delayed and nonsensical reactions. Massive moments don't feel like it, whereas they'll treat a missed preseason FG like it lost the super bowl. Madden should have multiple teams of commentators to keep it fresh, and have much more grandiose of a scope of lines recorded to pull from. If they were innovative I'd say they should start to look into use of AI to help make realistic real time reactions to stuff, I think the possibilities there are so exciting, but we all know EA doesn't innovate.

-still animation based gameplay

Now the thing I am even more qualified to comment on is the inner workings of franchise and team building. OOTP is the gold standard for this and I'll reference it a bunch because of that, but every sports franchise blows madden out of the water here. And again, disappointingly little progress has been made here, sometimes it is worse. 

-AI still feels less alive than any other sports video game. No game is perfect at immersion, but madden is truly bottom tier still. No adjustments are ever made by the CPU. Baffling team building logic. OOTP transports me to a new world, madden makes it painfully clear at all stops that it is a soulless video game made by a company that wouldn't piss on you if you were on fire. 

-Bugs everywhere, and the menu is sooo slow. I'm running a 3070/5800x build and the gameplay runs fine fps wise, but the menus still are like pulling teeth. I have heard people with worse computers not even being able to open the game.

-Compounding slow menus, the UI is somehow worse than when I quit madden half a decade back. 

-Scouting, also somehow worse. You literally have to fire your whole scouting department and rehire a new one every preseason to scout effectively. If madden doesn't care to make scouting realistic or fun (this iteration of scouting is neither) then why make it part of the game at all? OOTP doesn't have a scouting mechanic- you hire a scout, with money that you could have used elsewhere, and then you simply have to put trust into that scout that their evaluations are better than other teams' scouts. If you skimped on paying for a great scout you'll have consequences, but paying for the best scout means less money for players, developments, etc. It is different, but 100X more immersive and realistic than madden. I love scouting if done right, but if you don't care to do it right, you end up with a process that just feels painful as it does in M24 and would be better off without it entirely.

-I heard some say madden's created draft classes are improved, but I don't really see it. It's still a shell of what it could be, and still isn't realistic at all. I don't see varied enough skillsets, I still see far too many bad athletes, I see unrealistic skillsets, the terrible scouting system. I did enjoy that scouting grades aren't so specific anymore-"day 3" as a designation rather than "round 5" leaves it open to that player going anywhere from round 3 to undrafted, so if you like a guy you gotta take him. More realistic than before at least.

-not franchise specific per se, but one of my biggest sticking points that I honestly cannot believe has still not been addressed- positional designations. Mind mindbogglingly, draft prospects are *still* shoehorned into being "LG" or "ROLB" or "FS," when in real life guys are seen much more generally as an OT prospect, an off ball LB prospect, a pass rusher, etc. It makes absolutely no sense, all it does is needlessly complicate things. How has this still not been made more realistic? Get rid of the left vs right BS, that is not how any draft analyst actually looks at prospects, and all it does it add multiple extra menus to scouting that are needless. Especially when madden lets you edit any offensive lineman to any other position with no penalty- another thing they should address.

-Not only do they still bizarrely specify things like left vs right guard, they use positional names out of 2001. LE/RE/DT/OLB/MLB for every team and scheme still? No edge rusher designation? Absolutely embarrassing for everyone involved with this game that this has not been updated in 20 years. Players on defense should be listed as such- interior defenders, pass rushers, off ball linebackers, safeties, corners, with variations within- tweener iDL-edge players, LB/S hybrids, etc. This has been how it works for a long time now IRL, and updating it would simplify it so much! Instead, we *still* have 4-3 teams signing pass rushers with 40 coverage to play off ball, or 3-4 teams with 240 pound 3techs. It hurts my brain how little effort and knowledge it would take for madden to make this change, and what a difference it would make in the quality of their product, and they still haven't. Shameful. 


I could go on, but what's the point? Whoever is making decisions for this franchise decided long ago that integrity or pride was much less important than the bottom line, so they'll keep putting out $70 roster updates designed to take money from small children via MUT. If the NFL understood the importance of a good official video game for a sport, they'd have some standards for EA, but it doesn't look like that will ever happen. TL;DR- buggy, boring, soulless, don't buy. I'll get my hours in, if only to get my money's worth and see if I can get a workable experience to last me another half decade before I give this company money again. But if you're any less than a football starved maniac who hasn't bought madden in 6 years, don't bother, really.

First off all the negative reviews on here are just bashing the game like they have done prior years. This is the first year on pc in ages we have had an up to date game matching console(yawn). The running and movement in the game is weird to an extent. The players have inertia so for anyone who has played tarkov if you are heavy or are moving fast one way you don't stop on dime. Meaning the momentum you have will carry you a a little further. You cant just sprint full speed at the qb around the edge and expect to stay tight and swing up to tackle him. You have to let off the speed boost so you can make the cut up. Once you get that figured out and when to use speed boost and not its a decent game. I don't play mut cause its boring to me to play with a full team of superstars all 99. The real fun of the game is head to head or in franchise mode with friends. I would recommend this game only if you have played in the past few years of madden. I'm still learning this game and complain about it. I'm leaving this as a positive review cause the game is good just takes time to relearn the physics engine. Yeah sadly its EA but till someone else comes along (cough) 2K we have to deal with EA putting the same game out year after year and taking out good features to put in crap that doesn't work or makes the game worse.

I'll start with the positive, the game is an overall upgrade from madden 23 especially if you've never played with the next gen updates. Franchise so far has been super fun and the changes to trading, free agency, and relocation have been nice additions. I additionally enjoyed the return of superstar mode (even though it does lack some depth when it comes to character customization, gear, etc.). Now the negatives.. After about 15-20 hours of playing all audio decided to stop working (as of this post I still have not found a fix for this), this has made the game slightly more annoying to play but i usually mute the bland announcers  anyway. Another issue is the steam overlay not working in the game at all (haven't found a fix for this either). This game is a small step in the right direction but EA continues to have the same issues as usual. Franchise is a 9/10 (-1 points for slow and laggy menus) and overall I'd give the game a generous 7/10 (this is a very biased and generous 7 lol)

Yes, I had the bios error when i first started it, but my bios was out of date most like everyone else here.., just update your bios and I had no problems running this game. Runs great on PC, I locked my frame rate to 120, graphics are great, no stuttering and this is honestly this is the best Madden I've played in about a decade... So as much as there are negative reviews, I've had no problems...

Still gave them my money though...smh lol

The best I can say about 24 is that it's clearly trying new things in regards to gameplay and franchise mode. Systems from the previous year have been expanded or reworked much to the benefit of the playerbase, and the game feels much more fun than in years prior IMO. However, there are a few backwards steps in 24, and a slew of still unfixed or unattended matters that simply can't be excused when considering the increased game cost and the oodles of cash Madden brings in. Removed relocation teams, lack of custom/generic playbooks in coaching menus, player editing that doesn't allow for body-type edits, unrealistic auto-sim stats, lots of little things like that which add up over any significant playtime. To be clear, the larger push to improve the game has impressed me, and I feel that EA is on the right track, but we've been saying that for years. At this point, you just expect more from such a massive game franchise.

On St. Patrick's Day in 2015, I was in Southern California with a few friends to celebrate the holiday at a street festival. We got really drunk, danced to Irish music, had boxty, enjoyed many a fine and rowdy conversation, and as the night wrapped we ended up walking into a cute little Pho joint. 

The Pho we got from this place was the worst Pho I've ever had in my entire life. It was like they forgot salt. It was just beef water. There weren't even vegetables. It was meat in water. It was so bad we weren't even mad, we just laughed and decided to get something else later. 

For some reason I will never be able to explain, I took my chopsticks back to the hotel with me. And then home. They were good chopsticks. I ended up losing one of them at some point, but the other...it became my guiding light in life. If I needed a good back scratch, it could reach. If there was a spider web, it had me covered. I played with my cat with it. I even used it as a chopstick occasionally, though it often complained quietly about the dishwasher being too hot. My point is, it held a place of honor on my desk, standing alone, a champion above lesser inanimate objects. A companion tool that earned its place by my side for life through dedication and support. Sir Chop Steven. A Champion.

A disappointed letdown of a game. Runs with massive stutters and crashes on PC port. the number of bugs big and small are too much to list on here. From minute details like trying to hit the "like" on a custom draft class download only to see that it says "dislike or dislike" on both options to mini games bugging out during training camp. The customize character option is the least user friendly I have ever seen. It has to be the most generic program with the absolute minimal effort put into it leading to unrealistic builds when making players. AI is 50/50 on if it decides to work on a play or not. Year after year this company has put out an unfinished product but this year is just an embarrassment. The "make or break" year looks more like a market scheme to get people to buy. 

TLDR; makes hot garbage look appetizing. Save your money and upload a roster on an older edition or emulate ncaa 2013 while you wait until NFL pulls exclusivity rights from this company.

Alright I waited awhile to place my review up here and this is how I feel.

Its a Madden game, its different than Madden 23, its actually better in alot of ways and yes the same in others, but its overall a Madden game a football game, not sure what more you would want, maybe some shirtless people running around on the field? or some rockets shooting enemy players? Come on people. Lets get into pros and cons.

Pros:
- Madden/NFL game
- Fluid franchise lots of improvements
- MUT is still fun as heck
- Gameplay is alot better, can almost suplex people now.
- Next GEN
- Crossplay
- Anti-cheat

Cons:
- Laggy for alot of people
- Needs a major update to fix some of the issues
- UI needs a fix aswell
- MUT paywall again, needs more freebies
- Give us a patch EA 

Now I haven't bought Madden in many years, i've been using the EA sub to get them all for free, but I bought this years as its Next GEN and Crossplay, this is something that even 2K refuses to do, 2K refuses to even add a Anti-cheat program to get rid of the thousands of hackers on their games, but here EA takes the biggest step and throws in Anti-cheat and Crossplay. Give them credit where credit is due.

Again its a Madden/NFL game at the core of it, you get what you pay for and more, is it worth $70, of course to me it is, but in reality no its not. But im not a pirate and I love Madden football. I have already gotten my moniez worth believe me.

I don't expect EA to read this, but I stupidly pre-purchased this game and it did not run due to no fault of my own. First, an anticheat message pops up whether or not I have any anticheat software running. At first, i thought it was complaining that anticheat software was disabled, but now I'm not sure. It's not like I was planning to cheat since I don't play head to head and don't play MUT at all. Then I'm told Secure Boot is not enabled. Well, guess what/ the Steam page does not state that you must have Secure Boot enabled, so many of us spent money on this game with rigs that greatly exceed the posted specs and STILL cannot run it. So, I spent hours trying to learn about secure Boot and enabling it. Turns out, I could not find any such setting in my BIOS despite this being one of the most recent and expensive motherboards available. I spent well over a thousand dollars on an upgrade just a few weeks back. So far this is the first game that doesn't like my new CPU, RAM and/or motherboard. Why EA would care about Secure Boot or any anticheat software in a game I want to play solo, I don't know. If they are so worried about cheats, they could simply grey out the mutliplayer game options if you don't have Secure Boot running and the anticheat operating how they want. But this way I'm likely to just get a refund if they don't make their game playable on my system. So, they would be out money on a game I'd really like to play. I'll update this review if these things ever get fixed and I get a chance to play.

So, after almost a week, I FINALLY get Secure Boot working and Madden 24 runs, which means it asks me a skill level, wants to know my favorite football team, asks about sending my personal data around, and then places me in a mandatory passing tutorial, which I tried for hours and cannot get by. There are five kinds of passing in Madden 24. I don't know. Maybe the game is misinterpreting some of my keypresses. I don't use all the different kinds of passes in Madden anyway. I can find no way to get past or around this tutorial. So now I'm stuck. I didn't spend all this money to play nearly impossible tutorials. I paid to actually play a game. When can I get to that? Almost a week in, it's anybody's guess.

Madden 24 brings back the much-loved Superstar Mode and delivers a visually stunning experience on the PC platform. However, it's essential to note that this visual upgrade comes at the cost of demanding PC hardware and increased power usage. If you have the necessary setup, Madden 24 is a football fan's dream, offering an immersive journey through the NFL. Despite its resource-intensive nature, I would recommend Madden 24 to fans of the franchise who are ready to take their gaming experience to the next level.

The last Madden I played was nearly a decade ago. I thought that after so much time the game would have substantial improvements.

Yes, it's still fun to play simulation football and to play as your favorite players. Yes, some of the new physics stuff and celebrations are cool. But at the end of the day, I did not heed others' warnings about the fundamental faults of the game.

At its core, Madden is BROKEN. Players will get stuck on opponents and not know what to do, just run in place and screw up routes. There is a huge interception problem where defenders will come out of nowhere to pick you off, even if you made the correct read. A lot of the times, offensive and defensive AI are just absolute braindead idiots that do not react to plays like an actual human would. All of these problems are IMMERSION BREAKING.

Stay clear from Madden until they fix their physics engine at its core (which is very unlikely for EA), and for the love of God don't give them any more money or pay for MUT.

Any multiplayer mode even on lowest minimal settings stutters and is unplayable. Can play games like warzone and total war on max no problems, but madden 24 ultimate team, nope! Better luck next year for some devs that care about pc users.

This is my first comment .. well ever I think.. and I hate to do this but, here we go.  

I wanted so bad to like this game because I love football, but this is not NOT NOT NOT acceptable after all these years.  To EA sports, you have heard us, but obviously you do not care about how we feel, you just care about our money.  Look at how many hours I put into this game and see that I am giving a really honest opinion.  On top of that, I have over 1TB of recordings from Madden 22 until now to prove what I am saying is nothing but the truth.  

This game seemed playable at first, in fact it felt like I was having fun for a bit.  Until certain plays started to not make sense much sense.  I mean, I have recording showing players literally transporting to a specific part of the field without even moving their feet!  Like, WOW!  

If starts to feel like its scripted for specific scenarios in the game, like players will glide to an area and make a play.  Even worse, I play DT most of the time, and the game will sometimes make me swim left, when I purposely swim moved right lol, like its so obvious at this point that it makes me and my entire family not want to play a football game since this is the only choice at the moment.

I've had crashes on crashes, however... the gameplay I've managed to get in has been good - I have hope that EA will fix the issues for PC, I can't say if they're replicated in the console versions, however the additions made this year have been a step in the right direction, does not help you lot have a spotlight on you with repeated, subpar releases over the years that have left much to be desired.

Fix the issues, get this thing on the right path.

Ultimately, thumbs up, would just be nice to be able to finish a match or even changing a players accessories without a buggy mess that requires both keyboard and controller inputs to progress screens.

Fix it y'all, you got this.

EDIT: I went and upgraded my CPU I have had no issues with crashes, I believe this game is a step in the right direction. Since upgrading my hardware, I've had zero issues, the game still needs a bit of optimising, sure... but it is way better, the last Madden I bought was Madden 22, and it is a night and day difference for me anyway.

Early days, there are still gameplay glitches here and there, I will wait for a proper roster update by regular season, week four to start a franchise but Superstar and other game modes are fine since updating my hardware. If you're having repeated crashes upon loading into and exiting games, it might be your CPU holding you back. 

I am not defending EA at all, they need to really lift this up to meet a lot of the community standards, however, I am enjoying it.

I am mainly an offline player so take this review with a grain of salt. 

So far Navigating the menus has been painfully slow. In superstar mode something as simple as hitting "advance week" takes 10-15 seconds to register, than it does the sim of the other teams games, than another 10-15 second wait while it appears to just lag, than the week will finally start. Every menu you try and open, ie. settings, roster, upgrades, also have a massive delay after trying to enter them. This doesn't seem like much when you are used to games that navigate quickly or just don't feel like letting time just sitting there looking at a frozen screen add up it can be quite aggravating, especially with the price tag this game came with. 

The gameplay is more of the same from madden. When you hold A to skip through scenes you also end up sitting there waiting at a minimum of 20 seconds, which is almost not even worth it to hold A at that point. The screen freezes so you're basically watching a still frame of something for almost 30 seconds. If they could find a way to fix this lag I would say this is a decent step up from previous years but right now it just seems like more of the same from the madden franchise. 

Another thing I would like to bring up / complain about is that when your team accepts a penalty, the announcers will say really weird stuff like "Why would they accept that and give the ball back to the offense", when the penalty was like a pass interference on the defense and the context of their sentence makes absolutely no sense. I also had the announcers tell me that "The Ravens are coming into this game after their loss to Baltimore last week" which... I don't even understand how that happens. I also heard that "The Cowboys defense did an excellent job against the run last week against Dallas". On another side note in superstar mode it says that all of my stats are 1st in the league on the stat hotbar, however they are definitely not first in the league. ie I have 32 catches at this point and both Travis Kelce and Cooper Kupp have more than 32 catches but it still says I'm first in the league in receptions. I'm sure if I wanted to author a book I could sit here and give more reasons why I am yet again disappointed with madden and its single player experience but this was enough of a rant.

I will happily change my stance if some of these issues get addressed but I know madden has a history of not listening to the community or fixing problems that don't adhere to them making more money so not holding my breath.

A couple things right off the bat:

I had Madden 19.  Just got Madden 24.  Madden 24 has better player control.  I like the slowdown mode when QB passing.  Graphics and overall play (tackles, blocking, hits, catching, interceptions, etc.) are way more realistic.  

I am convinced these are the reasons for the bad reviews:

1.)  The game requires 20GB RAM for ultimate performance.  I have 16GB, gameplay is fine.

2.)  I have a 2.5GHz machine.  Forget what the minimum is.

3.)  My hunch is the negative reviewers for this game don't have a machine capable of running this game.

4.)  Secure boot - if you're getting the "secure boot is not enabled for this machine" error, your motherboard and/or CPU BIOS aren't up to date.  

First, check if "secure boot" is "off":

4a.)  Type "msinfo32" in the search bar.

4b.)  Under "system summary" on left pane, look for "secure boot state" on right pane.  It's about halfway down.  It probably says "off".  

To fix, try the below (Win 11 in this example):

4c.)  Type "settings" in search bar

4d.)  Under "system" on left, click on "recovery", then click on "restart now".  

4e.)  Machine reboots.  On restart, click "troubleshoot", click "advanced options", click "uefi firmware settings".  Click "restart".  Machine reboots again.  Your system should now read "secure boot = on" (see 4a., above).  

Hopefully this saves people time, and from going down the rabbit hole of trying to find BIOS update files that need to be booted from a floppy disk (A: drive).  For those of you who may not know, floppy disks were invented by dinosaurs.

UEFI is Windows firmware updating utility, Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI).  It's baked into Windows and saves us from the dinosaurs.  That's the 2 sentence explanation (for you purists out there), but one thing's for sure, if you don't have UEFI, get a new machine, it will save you the frustration in the long run.

Honestly, it's the best Madden in years. Obviously, next gen has been brought to PC, but it adds a whole lot more to single-player modes. They brought back drills and they're actually fun now instead of being a grind like they were in the past. The DB/WR battles are a lot of fun to play, especially. Franchise added a bunch of features, relocation is a lot easier, CPU coaches actually do clock management correctly, passing mechanics are a lot more fluid, draft generation is more developed, your franchise coordinators are actually unique and matter. I've yet to run into any major bugs or issues while playing.

The biggest improvement, in my opinion, has been difficulty, though. In previous Madden games, even on All-Madden, I was able to run up the score on the CPU, so I had to adjust the sliders to a ridiculous level. When I first launched this game and started a franchise, I set it to All-Madden, assuming I'd be fine. I lost 62-7, and it was my fault, not a bunch of bullshit CPU picks. I've switched back to All-Madden again after a quick tour in All-Pro, and now I actually have realistic records on the season and most wins are close games.

I don't give a shit about Ultimate Team and never have, and I'm still happy about this release. I feel like the game genuinely took a step forward. 

If you're not a chronic complainer and you just like Madden, at worst, this game will be fine for you. Even the FOTF replacement, Superstar Mode, is actually fun.

Also, if you notice, the vast majority of negative reviews have less than 5 hours of gameplay. I imagine I have a better understanding of the game after about 30 hours than those reviews do. But Madden fans are chronically bitter about anything in the game.

PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS GAME:     Worst madden i've ever bought and played in my life and I've been playing MUT since madden 2012. All that said, the lag is def there rn. The menus are slow af the games have some lag but I wouldn’t call it “unplayable,” but it is close. If it were any worse, it would be unplayable. I expect and hope they’ll fix some of this.

The depth chart autoreorder can be turned off so it doesn’t reset after every game (why tf did it take them 6-7 years to implement this???). 

The o-line play seems to be improved. The defense doesn’t catch every single ball that goes near them for the CPU. The animations, on Next Gen, are better. The precision passing seems a lil overly challenging as far as throwing a perfect ball.

Honestly, if we’re calling the last iterations (all being the same exact going back to 18) a 2/10, I think I’d give this a 5/10. It’s definitely got some improvements, but don’t expect a stellar game.

One of the worst madden games I've ever played. The tackling in this game is nonexistent. You wanna hit stick someone with your best linebacker or FS/SS? The running back breaks off the hit stick like it was nothing. Diving at the running back never works and the defender goes flying away from the ball or does this stupid half dive motion. BUT THE CPU DOESN'T MISS A HIT STICK OR TACKLE. Oh my safety has the ball hit him right in the hands and no receiver is near/ over thrown ball? IS NOT AN INTERCEPTION. The moment that very thing is the other way and happens to me, it is an interception 10/10 times without a fail. The commentary is the same old garbage every year. PICK NEW FREAKING COMMENTATORS! The dialog has sounded the same for 3 YEARS IN A ROW. As much as I was looking forward to playing these games of actually playing, it pains me to just simulate the franchise and play madden 24 that way. Waste of $70 dollars and yes, it is another $70 dollar roster update.
much improbed

Well EA, you've done it. You have made (by far) the worst Madden Franchise game I've seen as a player since Madden 2005. The amount of stupid things that happen throughout your gaming experience is enough to give a 23 year old a heart attack. I primarily play Franchise mode with friends in my time on this game and the amount of problems are truly insane that I must break them down by literal aspects of the game. 

For starters, if it wasn't obvious I play as the Miami Dolphins for my franchise primarily on All-Madden and the defense is literally broken naturally that you must alter damn near every aspect of it to play it properly, unless you want Bradley Chubb and Jaelen Phillips dropping into coverage... Now, lets continue with the defensive issues. You cannot tackle. It's literally impossible. The running backs break every fucking tackle - whether its aggressive, conservative or hit stick, they're bouncing off dudes like crazy and the receivers are only slightly easier to tackle. CPU pass blocking is unparalleled in strength, they get so much time in the pocket its crazy, 85 overall speed rusher Jaelen Philips has a whopping 3 sacks through 10 games and 80 overall power rusher Bradley Chubb has just 4 on the other side of the line. The pass coverage reaction is abysmal which is disappointing as I had seen many clips that showed it being improved for this years version of the game, however my DB's who are literally Jalen Ramsay, Jevon Holland and Xavien Howard, get smoked every fucking play and don't play the ball at all; then if you make the coaching adjustments to play the ball you can write off every possible tackle after catch you even had a chance of as they will soar right by them without hesitation. Now, lets by chance say you get an interception... the CPU doesn't worry because the ancient tight end Mercedes Lewis will run down Jalen Ramsay in a straight away going the other direction. No fucking way that ever happens. 

Now lets discuss the offense, going inversely to the issues on defense. My players never break a tackle, only time it happens is if I get the spam A break tackle prompt and i hit it, but even then it only shows up when I am smack in the center of 5 defenders so whats the use. My pass blocking is horrendous, like last year I notice moments where my tackle doesn't even touch the defender rushing. I'm running for my life and get unbelievable negative plays as a result and even with adjustments being made such as keeping a tight end in or a half back to pick up some stray blocks it just doesn't matter. Then this fucking momentum meter has some severely stupid enhancements - and let me be clear, I do like the momentum meter. However - in what situation does momentum make it so I don't even know my receivers??? That is the dumbest thing I have ever seen. Another issue I run into is in my season with the Denver Broncos I can't throw a go route to save my life. Dude will be wide open with 5 yards separation from the receiver and that sucker gets under thrown every time - its amazing. I have been Tyreek Hill with the ball in my hands on a straight away and a man chased me down running at an angle up the field, again, never going to happen. 

Even special teams is broken. I had 3 games in the rain and windy, the wind is not accurate. Playing in clear conditions my kicker can hit from 62 going full power, playing with 13 mph winds going in favor of me the ball came up way short from 59 out. Playing in rain with the wind going 16 mph up and to the right, aimed the kick ever so slightly to the left to adjust for it and the ball went hard left like i was aiming in to section G on my left hand side. 

Fix the fucking game. Make the game fair. Make harder difficulties be harder because they play smarter not make them broken and literally impossible to tackle. Make it so they have fucking clock management for fuck sake, for yet another year the CPU will run out of time going into half time on the 25 yard line in clear field goal range when they started their drive with 3 full time-outs. Game has promise but has sever game breaking issues in key spots that make it no fun. I've played madden every year since 2005 on All Madden and I'm 1-9 with the most overpowered team in the game specifically because "I can't play defense" because my players can't make a tackle with  3 people to assist them.
Great to have finally next gen graphics and physics for PC. Best Madden so far!

It's not that bad, and I certainly enjoy it more than I enjoyed Madden 23. Franchise Mode is awesome this year with a variety of locations to relocate to and the uniforms look better. The "new" features are nice, but I don't like calling them "new" since they were old but just got removed so EA rebrands as "new." Annoying how I have to go into BIOS mode and turn on secure boot because EA AntiCheat requires it. Feels pretty unnecessary and I think EA could've easily just fixed it on their end. The gameplay at first was really choppy and laggy. Now after tweaking some settings, it's playable but still not smooth as butter. I'm pleased with it because the only thing I do on Madden is play franchise mode. I would love to play online H2H crossplay, but I just know Madden is going to shit the bed for PC users so I won't even attempt to try that out. If you really want to play a football game, then you should wait until this is on sale. Paying $70 is outrageous. But I enjoy it.

This is quite possibly the worst Madden game EVER produced. I haven't bought one in a few years so I figured I was due. BIG MISTAKE. Do not believe the lies about improved anything or added features. The features added are either useless, broken or both. They're also just re-added features from old Madden games that are poorly re-implemented. 

-1 out of 5 running plays will have a holding penalty so it's basically pointless. I had to turn off holding completely to be able to run the ball.
-Controller will drop input at random either in menus or during plays. Happens more often in menus resulting in random scrolling.
-Route running gets broken during press coverage and receivers just run around random directions or right out of bounds. They also just stop running routes at random. Slant route? You meant stop running at the hash mark right? Picked.
-Random frame rate drops for no reason at all.
-Constant mini-freezing in menus when trying to call plays.
-Probably removed more features from franchise mode than they added, and the implementation on those added are awful copy and pastes from past games. 
-"Manage team" is a whole menu just to rebuild your entire stadium, to the same 6 templates they had 10 years ago, or relocate. No upgrades, no renovations. Absolutely nothing new at all, just half way re-added features from old games.
-Absolutely ridiculous glitchy ball carriers breaking 10 tackles, spinning out of a massive pile up and running 80 yards for a TD. Don't worry though, most long runs get called back for holding even if it's 50 yards behind the play.
-The training camp drills are broken. They're either glithched to the point of being pointless (Pass rush tunnel drill. The linemen will follow you down the tunnel and get in the way) Or just about learning to exploit buggy AI (WR Red Zone Drill. The only way to get the top score is to run whip routes over and over again). The "drills" are pointless and have no application on how to play Madden or football.
-Commentary is the worst I've ever heard. Pointless rambling that has nothing to do with what is happening. Or things like "That Ravens defense was really great last week in their win against Baltimore." Zero quality control as usual.

My first instinct was to refund immediately and I should have listened. I'm going to play a few seasons of franchise mode and go back to College Football Revamped because NCAA 14 is a better game than any Madden in the last decade.

Take all the negative reviews with a grain of salt. They make decent points, but today there is a culture around bashing developers because a game isn't perfect. EA is EA and we know where their priorities in developing games. Unfortunately, nothing will change unless they lose the NFL license and get some competition. I'm a firm believer that the blame should not be placed on the developers, as most of them simply want to make a good game. This is undermined by a lack of consistency in the dev team, money-first decisions from higher-ups, and EA's complacency knowing NFL fans will buy it simply because there are no other licensed options. Welcome to 21st century capitalism.

Is the game buggy? Yes. Is there still missing features that were included in Madden games 10+ years ago? Also, yes. Its not ground-breaking by any means, nor will it be remembered as a good year for Madden, but if you enjoyed played any of the recent Maddens and are excited about finally getting current gen features and graphics on PC, it is still fun.

For once it seems the Madden franchise is going in the right direction.

Observations after most of an exhibition game:

Good:
Graphics have improved - ultra settings look better than ever IMO.

Playcalling - Texans vs Chiefs - believable play calling.

Animations / Tackling - Improved

Replays - There are less and they didn't show a replay of a kick going out of bounds inside the 20.

Bad:
When a team scores, before kicking off to the opposing team - WHY is their offense and opposing teams defense shown huddling on the field? Why does it last for 30 seconds or so? If KC scores - their offense should be on the sidelines - but nope, they're out on the field yakking for 30 seconds. Immersion breaking. Plus, regardless of who is on the field - seriously, 30 seconds or so - let's get on with it! 
   
Scoreboard celebrating 1st down - on 2nd down.

After a play, the ball is observed with the player's hand stuck through the middle of the ball.

Music - turned off immediately. Rap / hip-hop is as divisive as you can get. The little that I heard was "better" than previous Maddens, but so is sticking pencils in my ears.

Graphics - Yes, they look nice - but there is pretty significant stutter when camera is switched from time to time - my hardware isn't quite top of the line - but it should never stutter like this.

Commentary - Does EA pay again for reused voice lines? Also, not every play needs color commentary - it's just too much IMO. Maybe watch a few games with Madden / Summerall to see how it's done properly. Also, quite often the commentary doesn't match the play - commentary talking about how Kelce was wide open / green grass during a 75 yard play when, in fact, he broke 2 tackles almost immediately after catching the ball.

Replays - Nice that there are less - too bad that it doesn't replay the big plays (interceptions for example) but will replay a 6 yard run.

Heavy Rain Game - Bright and sunny. Holdover from Madden 23 - you couldn't even fix this EA?

Starting the game - WAY too many "Ultimate Team" and whatever ads - just take me to the damn menu, thanks.

Controls - Same as last few years - controls are entirely favored for controllers, not mouse / keyboard. Had to close the game from desktop as no matter what keys I tried on the keyboard the game wouldn't stop (and I tried everything that made any sense at all).


Understand - I rarely "play" Madden - I tend to WATCH Madden. For me, it's about immersion - does it feel like I'm watching an NFL game. Replays should be shown when it's appropriate, commentary should be limited to where it is interesting and adds to the experience, teams don't have their offense on the field after scoring, etc. Oh, and have to have a commercial break every 3 minutes (okay, thankfully that isn't part of the game).
   
I'm sure I'll come up with more. I don't think it's as bad as some of the reviews would have a person believe, and I see potential once the game is patched (assuming it actually addresses the issues). It needs "polish" - it really gives me the feeling that it was rushed for the PC version - as in the PC version is an afterthought (not comforting as I'll never have a game console). I'll say that it's recommended but I would completely understand if folks wait until some patches come out as the game could use some serious polish.

Edit: After further review, cannot recommend this in its current state of "optimization". Madden 23 ran on ultra settings on my laptop, peaked CPU temps at about 72 degrees. Madden 24, running on medium settings, CPU temps hitting 89 - it's not using the GPU as it should. This game is currently not optimized for PC and seriously needs a patch ASAP.

Genuinely decent (albeit it very minor) improvements over the previous two installments. However, incremental improvements on a game that was broken by choice to begin with is not real progress. Every year big changes are promised - and every year minimal baby-steps are what is actually delivered. The Madden franchise is still vastly and laughably inferior to other sports sims, even compared to others also in the EA family. Unfortunately, it's been made clear that EA is fine with mediocrity. And evidently, so too is the NFL. Their exclusive license agreement ends in 2026, and I gotta hope the impending renewal isn't exclusive, so football fans have access to better product offerings on the video game end.

Alright let me start by saying this, I was a huge Madden fan back in the day.  Since I have gotten a PC I have never gotten the Madden games because of reputation, poor optimization, etc. But I was excited for this year since PC  is getting the next gen port, which it should anyway. My PC, and many others, rig is entirely capable and would smash a PS5 or Xbox any day of the week. Let me get off of my soap box and tell you about why you are here. Look first and foremost is it the greatest football game  ever... NO of course not. But when it works, which is the big issue right now, I thoroughly enjoy this game.  The secure boot issue was the first problem I ran into. Honestly for me at least wasn't a big deal even if you don't know what you are doing which I didn't. Thankfully the internet exists and YouTube is a thing. Secondly and this is a problem that I haven't been able to fix just yet.  The game runs fine for me for the most part. You see like I said I have been a Madden fan for a long time and since Ultimate Team in Madden 10 I have loved UT for the most part. Ultimate Team has seen it's better days in the past, but it is still an enjoyable experience nonetheless.  I have been playing Ultimate Team solo, I never was interested in online play, and with the challenges and solo battles like I said they run well for the most part, but there is some issues. For some reason no matter how beefy your rig is there is some lag/slowdown in game. For me this mostly occurs while on the offensive side of the ball, but I have seen it on defense. Mostly I see the lag right after a score when I am trying to go for the extra point. Which you can see can become a massive pain in the ass due to precise kicking timer not syncing up due to slowdown. Leading to a losing score on my end not due to my own accord. But like I said this is my first Madden and I am enjoying this game very well when it does work especially with the new passing mechanics. And I don't know how long this has been in the game or it is just the new "field sense" mechanic but it does feel a bit more on the Simulation side of things now, which I enjoy a lot. I know this is crazy but at some point I believe that EA will patch the bugs up and this game will run a lot better. For those thinking about giving this game a try just know that you will run into some minor issues, that should be fixed eventually, but there is a great game underneath.

The game is essentially unplayable at this point.  Frame rate issues and frame drops abound when actually playing the game, particularly when the new passing textures and icons come up.  The stutter makes reaction time and decision-making impossible.

The UI is glitchy as anything.  It is slow, unresponsive, prone to errant input not directed by users, and generally just fluky.

There are issues with the anti-cheat software that occassionally prevents the game from launching, and occassionally causes the game to crash.

Should I have pre-ordered?  No, that was my bad.  The cross-platform play sucked me in, and I knew better.  Is this a game worth $70?  Good grief, no.  This game isn't worth $20.  It's worth a consideration at around $5, maybe, if they fix the FPS issues.  Otherwise, buyer beware.

This game seems very fun, but there's one issue I have with it. That issue is the fact that I can't even forking play it! This account is owned by me and another person who will remain anonymous. This is definitely a make or break year for madden and I hope EA realizes that.

I'll start with the pros:
1. Gameplay compared to last years steam version is a million times better with the implication of the skill based passing alone. Running the ball feels sooo much better with quicker cuts you can hit holes so much more efficiently
2. Graphically with the updated player models it looks so much realistic and simply just more visually appealing.
3. The ui layout is super simple and easy to find things especially in Ultimate Team.

Now the cons:
1. Menus are super laggy and unresponsive when swiching menus in UT.
2. Rewards for UT not showing up, mainly in house rules
3. Online games sometimes feel really slow and laggy

So the reason I am giving this a positive review is that they have a lot of things right and if they can keep building off that and adding new content this year could be my favorite Madden in years. However if they can't fix simple issues quickly and effectively so that we aren't affected by the same issues 5 or 6 times like last year I have no issue not buying the game next year. With that being said I am hopeful that EA finally turns it around this year and Madden games will finally be fun again.

My review as a long time franchise player (over 20 years).
Pros:
-Best animations and attention to detail on the field yet. 
This was long overdue and is here now.
-Overall graphic qualities are solid.
-Commentary although eventually repetitive actually has smoother dynamic lines this year.

Cons:
-Clunky menu actions. It shouldn't be so un-optimized on my high-end pc. The reason is simple lots of network comms going on in the background causing the UI to be sluggish. Really annoying.
-Not impressed with the interface at all, seems very little effort was made to make it stand out as new or fresh.
-on field sound fx are weak in terms of variety etc. I do hear some decent player voice chatter but the default settings are set too low.
Overall I give it a 7.5. A decent showing for pc.

I know a lot of people don’t like this game or EA. I really dont agree with EA’s antics and how they don’t care about their consumers. However, coming from 23, this game is, in my opinion an upgrade. I’m playing before release (August 17th) and it’s been a lot of fun! The only downside, is that the game has stuttering issues and needs to be optimized on PC, as well as having some graphical glitches. I really wish they’d get rid of their anti cheat, or fix it in some way, to lessen the load. 

The game looks good, it plays okay, but overall it’s just another madden. I put 178 hours into 23, and I know I’ll put a couple hundred into this as well because I’m a big football fan and it does it’s job. So, spending $70 was worth it to me. 

Would I recommend buying it? Maybe. If you don’t like jank, if you hate EA with a passion, no. If you enjoy madden even though it sucks, and jank doesn’t bother you too much, id say go for it.

Ya know... I am so happy about Madden finally being updated on PC to feature all next gen features. Yet there is always two negatives for every positive. The presentation has yet to change in about 10 years. There is no love and care for the details on the field. No real time weather, no field changes in rain or snow. Its the same stupid footprints that were introduced years ago. Commentary remains unchanged, same repeated sentences over and over. They said they fixed rubber banding but thats BS. Linebackers never look at the ball, always catch up and jump in front of the ball on a throw. The CB are beat, the ball is over and out in front yet somehow they have superman abilities and still swat it away. I was so hopeful this year. They sent out surveys on what people want to see and were pretty specific. Nothing was addressed it seems. They should really stop putting out a new game every year and just focus on making the basics better. I will continue to play but my god I am not happy with it. I wish EA had some competition to really push this game forward and innovate.

My review will be mainly about the Superstar Mode

Backstory: I was super excited for the dedicated Superstar mode improvements.  It always seemed like that was the first mode to suffer(or be removed entirely), yet it was why I bought these games.  I loved making a player and following their journey.  Good times.  I skipped M23, so I'm sorry if anything was already implemented/redundant.

Review TLDR:  Overall the game IS fun.  But there are several things that make that fun short lived.  If you love the Madden franchise, wait for the sale.

PROS: 
-The skills and progression system seem fun and exciting, and reward different play-styles at the same position.  Leaves it open to more replayability and customizing. 
-A lot of customization options for gear.

CONS:
-With all the control they added, the game just feels less responsive and more sluggish.  Juking with a character that has less than 85 stat, looks like they attempting a line dance on the field... My 75 year old uncle could perform a more convincing juke.
-The camera is a nightmare situation.  When the ball goes to anyone but you, the camera leaves you behind making it so you can't see what you're doing or where you're going.  I've had several block in the backs called on my guy because I'm either running my route still for that split second, and then run into the back of the guy that's covering me, BOOM flag.  Extremely Frustrating.
-the game stuttering is the killer for me.  When running drills the game stutters when your get right to a defender, making it really hard to juke, spin or truck properly.
-The progression tree and skills are cool, but there's little explanation on what the benefit is for each skill and the impact they will make, the stats are a little better.  Some are straight forward, but some are worded a little more confusingly.

If I think of anything else or they massively overhaul things (lol)... I'll update this.  

If you are still reading:  You are amazing, don't ever forget your value and have yourself a fantastic day!!!!

Madden 24 is a big improvement over last year, but it isn’t without bugs or issues. Graphics and animations received an upgrade and there are some improvements such pass blocking and defense players knocking the ball away from WR’s more often. PC gamers also finally got the next-gen upgrade in addition to online cross-play. The biggest issue with the PC version is it isn’t optimized well resulting in lag during online gaming; however, this can be resolved in the graphics setting by capping your FPS at 60. Hopefully we will see a PC optimization update soon in the near future. Otherwise, this is a very solid and fun football game!

When I learned that Madden 24 was going to have cross-play for their online game modes, i was beyond excited to play madden as soon as it released. Specifically, I had 5 other friends that wanted to start a Franchise Mode. Well, of course EA being the dog shit company that it is, has not made cross-play compatible with Franchise mode, instead it is limited to their PVP money making formats. While this is the primary reason for my negative review, ill also mention they have not done anything to optimize performance, especially on PC, and the menu lag is unbearable at times. The game hasn't really been innovated upon compared to M23 and retains a lot of the problems that came with it. The positives are that rosters have been updated, and they changed the physics a bit in game. 

Whoever is in charge of Madden is an idiot. I don't understand why this game hasn't become a game service model where you retain and IMPROVE upon the existing structure. Then every year you have a new, dare I say, Season, where you reset everything. No, that would be too obvious, gotta make a completely new game every year (but not really)... morons. One of the most anti-consumer games out there, and if I wasn't a football fanatic, I would have refunded my purchase. TLDR, EA continues to be garbage.
